La señora Juana Evangelista, es una persona emprendedora y responsable con sus obligaciones, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco  de la tarde, los siete días de la semana en su negocio venta de tomates, en uno de los mercados capitalinos, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en el negocio, ambos son trabajadores, ella se encarga de la venta y atención de sus clientes  y el esposo realiza las entregas y almacenaje de las cajas de tomates. 

Solicita un préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de tomates. Esto con el propósito de comprar mas productos, debido a que esta temporada hay bastante demanda de este producto y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y captar mas compradores.  
 
Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Evangelista’s an enterprising person who is very responsible with her obligations.  She works every day from six in the morning until five in the afternoon seven days a week selling tomatoes in one of the markets in the capital.  She works alongside her husband; they are both hardworking.  She takes care of sales and customer service and her husband does the deliveries and stores the crates of tomatoes.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to invest in working capital to buy tomatoes.  This is with the goal of buying more products because demand is high during this season and she will have more variety on-hand to capture more buyers.  

She thanks Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the trust placed in her.  She will invest this loan in her business in such a way that she’ll be able to provide sustenance for her home and gradually improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 60 years old. She is a widow and has seven children and fourteen grandchildren. Despite her age, she has not stopped working hard to bring up her children and grandchildren.

Joyce earns her income by selling groundnuts at the roadside. She is also a full-time Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Joyce has learned marketing and business skills.

The additional income that she earns as a Solar Sister has helped Joyce scale her groundnuts business from selling 20 kilograms per week to now selling 200 kilograms of groundnuts per week. 

Joyce uses the money she gets to support her family and buy her children's scholastic materials for school.

Her biggest dream is to become a role model to young girls. Joyce also wants to teach her children to become better business people by introducing them to Solar Sister.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lamps to sell in her community.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old. She is married and has three children. She is now pregnant with her fourth child. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Jennifer helps to support her family with income earned through agricultural production (especially rice growing). She is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell clean, portable solar lanterns in their communities. 

As a Solar Sister, Jennifer has learned marketing and business skills. She uses the extra income for buying scholastic materials for her children, as well as clothing.

Jennifer dreams of becoming a superstar in business and a role model to all the mothers in her village. She wants to make a difference in her community.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a small business where she makes banana and taro chips to sell in her community. Rosalina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.

Rosalina is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as taro, banana, oil, flavor, and a frying pan to make her chips. She plans to earn more and save her earnings to help her children's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as taro, banana, and oil to make chips

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is widowed and has five children, all of whom currently attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and she also looks after her grandchildren. For the past 15 years, Jane has been selling scrap metal wholesale and she works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. Jane rents a house with access to electricity and no running water and her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent. Her business challenges include transportation. Jane joined MCDT because of their low interest rates.

Jane is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy scrap metal to sell. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy metal scrap to sell

loans.name: Faalili

texts.en: Faalili is a 38-year-old married woman who has five children. She has a small plantation where she grows yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faalili has requested a loan to buy products to improve the condition of her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With the profits from her plantation, Faalili hopes to expand and find more ways to export her goods.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, cement, carpet, and a wheel barrow to make home improvements

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: Melania is a 36-year-old married woman who has one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Melania has requested a loan to buy more equipment for her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Melania hopes to provide her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, a grass sprayer, boots, and a bush knife

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS INTOCABLES  está compuesta por doce integrantes de los cuales diez  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Rosalía tiene 31 años, casada tiene dos  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Pucarani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosalia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Rosalia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas. En la foto hay trece integrantes ya que una de las socias del banco fue acompañada de su hermana.
texts.en: The “Las Intocables” (The Untouchables) communal bank has 12 members ten of which are women and two are men; they are in different lines of work.  The bank president is Rosalía, 31.  She’s married and has two school age children.  She works knitting sweaters and alpaca blankets for women.  Her workshop is at home located in the Pucarani zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Rosalía will use it to buy alpaca wool at wholesale to knit sweaters and blankets because sales are very good these days.  She delivers orders to various markets in the city of El Alto.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase working capital.  The business challenge Rosalía faces is stocking her merchandise and will use profits to continue buying her supplies for knitting sweaters at wholesale.  Thirteen people appear in the photo because one of the member’s sisters came to the meeting with her.

loans.use: to buy yarn for sweaters.

loans.name: Jacqueline Lissette

texts.es: Jacqueline Lissette de 28 anos de edad, casada sin hijos, del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Y es una ciudad que se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, con gente muy acogedora, trabajadora, responsable, amables. Jacqueline tiene por actividad económica la venta de gaseosas, cosméticos, venta de recarga. Desde hace ocho anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que ayude a los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra y venta de productos como: gaseosas, pintura de labios, lápiz de ojos, rubor, perfumees, body, crema corporal,  vanidades. Jacqueline agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jacqueline Lissette, 28, is married and has no children.  She’s from León Department, a place located in the western part of the country and a city noted for being a tourist destination with very welcoming, hardworking, responsible, kind residents.  Jacqueline’s economic activity is selling soft-drinks, cosmetics and mobile phone airtime cards.  She’s been in said activity for 8 years.  The business arose because she needed to have a source of income to help with household expenses.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock her business.  She will buy products like lipstick, eyeliner, blush, perfume, body cream and make-up. Jacqueline is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca  tiene 45 años es casada tiene dos  hijos que tienen la edad de 17 y 21 años, ella se dedica a la confección de sabana y edredones, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Francisca  utilizara este préstamo para compra te telas por rollo para la confección de sus edredones y sabanas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Francisca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Señora Francisca is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, who are 17 and 21 years old. She makes sheets and comforters. She has been working in this business for a number of years. Her workshop is located in the Villa Fátima zone. This is her first loan with this institution. Señora Francisca will use this loan to buy fabrics by the roll to make her comforters and sheets. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of working capital. Señora Francisca faces challenges in her business, which are to continue improving the quality of the construction of her products. She is going to use the earnings to continue increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets and comforters

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Buwama, Uganda. She has two biological children and two other children who are under her care. In total, she has four children: two girls and two boys.

Florence plays many roles in her community. She runs a study center in the town of Buwama that teaches people basics in computing and typing services, and she is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar-powered lanterns and phone charging to their communities. With this Kiva loan, Florence will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community.

Florence loves being a Solar Sister because it helps her earn additional income. She uses the income she earns as a Solar Sister to supplement her children's school fees. The money also helps her to buy household items for the house like sugar, salt, etc.

Florence's biggest motivation in selling solar lanterns is seeing her community empowered. She has seen many accidents in her neighborhood that have been caused as a result of kerosene lanterns. 

Her biggest dream is to build her own home and also start an entertainment business, using one of the bigger solar-powered kits that powers a 21-inch TV and radio.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She is married with six children.

Mary is a full-time Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Mary has learned marketing and business skills. 

Mary uses the money she earns to support her family and to pay school fees.

Mary’s dream is to save up and own a shop, where she can sell more things and also make more people aware of solar technology and how they can be empowered by it.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Moelosa

texts.en:
Moelosa is 35 years old and married with five children. For the past year, she has been making and selling tapa (cloth made from bark) clothing and printed material to earn a living. Moelosa joined SPBD in 2010 to access financial services.

Moelosa is requesting a loan to buy paint, a design board, brushes, and rubber bands. She plans to use the profit from her loan to support her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy paint, a design board, brushes, and rubber bands

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been operating an eating place for three years and works five days a week. She also sells blocks for building as another source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, flour, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil, green bananas and charcoal. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business. She rents a house without access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil, green bananas and charcoal

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean, 36, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosejean owns and oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosejean dreams to give her children a good and quality education and hopes to be successful in her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is 48 years old and married with two children. For many years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as soap, snacks, washing powder, and other products. Sela became a member of SPBD in 2008 to access business capital. 

Sela is requesting a loan to buy soap, washing powders, sugar, salt, snacks, and other products. She hopes to use her profits to help with the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soap, washing powders, sugar, salt, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with three children, one of whom currently attends school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after additional family members. For the past three years, Justine has been running a restaurant from her home. She works seven days a week and has no other source of income. Justine's challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house without access to electricity or running water and her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Justine is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy rice, beef, chicken, beans, cow peas, green bananas, and charcoal. In the future, her dream is to expand her business into a big restaurant that serves all types of dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, beef, chicken, beans, cow peas, green bananas, and charcoal

loans.name: Lufo

texts.en: Lufo is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Lufo needs a loan to get all the equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lufo will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, shovels, fertilizer, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and is married with four children. He sells rice. He has four years of experience with this business, and he works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week except Sunday.

Joseph has requested a loan via Vision Finance Company, Kiva's field partner, in order to purchase a huge quantity of rice for resale. With any profits, Joseph plans to reinvest in his business, save for his future and buy medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantities of rice for resale.

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren, 34, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a transport business using his own automobile. His wife works as a cook in restaurant, and his daughters go to high school. Soon, his beloved younger brother is getting married, and he wants to present a home to the new couple. However, due to financial problems, he can’t afford to purchase the home himself, so he is requesting a loan of 1000000 MNT. It is a well-insulated traditional home that will reduce the family's coal consumption, which will have a positive impact on the environment.

loans.use: to buy a home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sausage

loans.name: Abraham David

texts.es: El Sr. Abraham tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos,  el se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Minero San Juan de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El  Sr. Abraham va a usar este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que su vehículo está presentando algunas fallas  y esto no le permite trasladar sus comida al puesto de venta y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, El Sr. Abraham es una persona joven muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Abraham, 35, has two children.  He works selling food in a stand located in the city of Cochabamba’s Minero San Juan zone.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Abraham will use it to service his vehicle.  His reason for requesting this loan is that his vehicle is having some mechanical problems which prevents him from being able to transport his food to his sales stand.  He will use profits to continue buying ingredients to improve his income.  Abraham is a hardworking young man who feels happy for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to service and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: la Sra. Graciela sigue con la actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad de una tienda de barrio, cuenta que le fue bien con el credito anterior ya que lo utilizo en la compra de huevos y leche, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como abarrotes, referscos variedda de dulces y galletas para surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Graciela continues with her activity selling basic staples in a neighborhood store.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan since she used it to buy eggs and milk.  On this occasion, she requests the loan to buy merchandise like grocery items, soft-drinks, a variety of candy and cookies to stock her store.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra.  Marcela tiene 55 años, sigue con la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Marcela va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marcela, 55, continues selling basic staples like groceries, candy, soft-drinks and a variety of items in her neighborhood store.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Marcela will use it to buy a variety of grocery items like rice, noodles, flour and sugar to stock her store and have a wider variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel de 43 anos de edad, casada con dos hijos de 15, 10 anos los cuales están estudiando. Es originaria del departamento de León. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Gloria tiene 16 anos de experiencia en el negocio el cual esta ubicado en un lugar especifico de la localidad.  Gloria es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora. Con buena solvencia de pago, en los créditos anteriores ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa y calzado como: pantalones, blusas, vestidos, short, ropa interior, sandalias zapatos deportivos, zapatos tenis chinelas. La rutina diaria de Gloria es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, para poder obtener y mejorar sus clienta y sus ingresos porque es la forma de poder mantener a su familia. Gloria Isabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Gloria Isabel is 43 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 10, who are in school. She is originally from the department of León, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. Gloria has 16 years of experience in her business, which is at a fixed location in the district. Gloria is a very responsible and hard-working woman. With a good payment history for her previous loans, she has shown responsibility in making her payments in full and on time. She needs financing to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling clothing with items such as pants, blouses, dresses, shorts, underwear, sandals, sport shoes, tennis shoes, and flip-flops. Gloria's daily routine is to work some 10 hours a day to be able to obtain and increase her clientele and her income, because it is the way she is able to maintain her family. Gloria Isabel is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to her and to people of scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business by buying pants, blouses, dresses, shorts, underwear, sandals, sports shoes, tennis shoes, and flip-flops

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in Anonang, Aurora, and has one child. For the past 11 years, he has been earning money by proving transportation services. Dennis earns 6,350 PHP each month from his business. He joined GDMPC in 2010.

Dennis is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to buy spare parts for his vehicle. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Uimaitua

texts.en:
Uimaitua is 30 years old and married with two children. For the past three years, she has run a small business where she sells donuts, drinks, and other products in her community.  Uimaitua joined SPBD in 2010 to access capital.

Uimaitua is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as flour, sugar, oil, baking soda, and an oven to expand her canteen. She plans on using the earnings from her loan to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, baking soda, and an oven to expand her canteen

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 33 years old and is married with a child. He is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past three years, Arman has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business. He joined GDMPC in 2011.

Arman is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase the spare parts needed to maintain his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase the spare parts needed for his motorcycle

loans.name: Limaiva

texts.en: Limaiva is a 31-year-old married woman who has two children. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas, yams, taro, and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Limaiva has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, filings, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Limaiva hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, filings, a wheelbarrow,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria de 53 años, su esposo ahora es jubilado, ambos después de sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad ahora ellos le retribuyen todos esos sacrificios  ayunándolos económicamente, solamente una de 15 años está a cargo de doña Gloria y su esposo, su mayor deseo es que termine sus estudios, con su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos ella ha logrado cubrir la mayor parte de sus gastos, solicita el crédito para instalar cerámica en su casa y terminar de construir un cuarto para esto necesita comprar cemento, baldosa, porcelana, separador plástico, cerámica, bloques, hierro, alambre, arena y pagar la mano de obra, todo esto con el objetivo de ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda con apoyo de Afodenic y Kiva con los que está muy agradecida por sus avances.
texts.en: Gloria is 53 years old and her husband is retired.  Both sacrificed to get their five children ahead by helping them financially.  Only their 15 year old daughter still needs support and Gloria and her husband’s greatest desire is for her daughter to finish school.  They have been able to cover most of the tuition expenses through their clothing and cosmetic sales businesses.  She is asking for a loan to install a tile floor and finish building a room.  She needs to buy cement, tiles, porcelain, plastic separators, cinder blocks, iron bars, wire, sand, and pay for labor.  All this is to improve the home’s infrastructure.  She is very grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for helping her move forward.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es:
Cordiales Saludos. 
Este es el grupo “Señor Nazareno” conformado por 07 socios dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales,  siendo la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Margarita una de las integrantes que  empezó su negocio en la venta de frutas y confitería hace muchos años. Al verse en la necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos decide mudarse y dedicarse a brindar servicio de limpieza y cocina. Con mucho esfuerzo logro comprarse algunas mesas y sillas, así emprender su negocio de la  venta de anticuchos. Gracias a este  negocio Margarita puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Su anhelo a  futuro es de instalar  un restaurante en su vivienda. Con el crédito solicitado comprara insumos para su negocio como carnes, aceite, ensaladas y papas.  Ella y todo el grupo desean seguir trabajando con Edaprospo y agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Margarita de 41 años  es separada y tiene 02 hijos. Margarita se encuentra sentada y viste polo color celeste.
texts.en:
Cordial Greetings,

This group is called “Señor Nazareno” and is made up of seven members with different businesses.  Most of them are from the same zone.  Margarita is one of the members and started her fruit selling and confectionary business many years ago.  She saw the need to increase her income, so she decided to move and also provide cleaning and cooking.  With great effort she was able to buy some tables and chairs and start her kebob business.  Thanks to this business, Margarita is able to provide a better quality of life to her children.  Her future desire is to buy supplies for her business such as meats, cooking oil, salads, and potatoes.  She and her whole group want so continue working with Edaprospo and appreciate those who make this loan possible.  Margarita is 41 years old, separated and has two children.  In the image she is the one who is seated and wearing a baby blue polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: María Gabriela de 26 anos de edad, casada con un hijo de tres anos, ella es originaria del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Gabriela se caracteriza por se una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbres.  María tiene por actividad económica una farmacia ubicado en un lugar específico de su localidad. Tiene diez meses de experiencia en el negocio. y surgió para tener un medio de trabajo y fuentes de ingresos para los gastos de su hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra y venta de medicamento genéricos de todas las casas comerciales como: jarabe para la tos, acetaminofén, alprasolan, losartan, genfribrosilo, gliblencamida, acido mefenamico. Panadol, antigripales, entre otros. María Gabriela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo digno.
texts.en: María Gabriela is 26 years old, married, and has a three year old son.  She is from the Leon department, a place located in the western part of the country.  María Gabriela is a hardworking, responsible woman with good customs.  She has a drugstore located in a special place in her home and has had it for ten months.  It was born from a need of for work and an income to pay the household expenses.  She needs this loan to buy pharmaceuticals of all types, such as cough syrup, alprazolam, losartan, gemfibrozil, glibenclamide, mefenamic, Panadol, and anti-flu medication, among other things.  She appreciates the help the Kiva lenders give to those of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that she can have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Lucrecia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lucrecia de 50 anos de edad de la localidad de León, madre soltera con dos hijos independientes. Lucrecia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbres, con ganas de superación personal. Ella es originaria de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lucrecia tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada y calzado de segunda mano.  Ella tiene 4 anos de tener el negocio, y lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de pacas de segunda mano de buena calidad y aprovechar  la temporada navideña que cuando las ventas se incrementan y los ingresos también. Dentro de la paca existe ropa de niños como camisetas, pantalones, faldas, short, vestidos, camisas. Pijamas.  Lucrecia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lucrecia is 50 years old and from Leon.  She is a single mother of two adult children and is a hardworking, responsible woman with good customs and a desire to get ahead.  She is originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country.  [Lucrecia] sells second hand clothing and shoes.  She’s been doing this from a special place in her home and needs this loan in order to stock her business by buying packs of good quality second hand clothing so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season.  This is when her sales and incomes increase.  The packs contain children’s clothing, t-shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, and pajamas.  She appreciates the help the Kiva lenders give to those of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that she can have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya, 26 years old, lives with her husband and two-year-old child in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Since 2007, she has been working as a seller in her brother’s counter. In 2010, Sarantuya purchased her own counter and began selling winter clothes and bags. 

In summertime, Sarantuya's husband works in the construction sector and in winter he helps with her business. Also, her husband renders taxi services with his own car. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, the demand for winter clothes is increasing greatly, so Sarantuya is requesting the loan of 3500000 MNT to supply these winter clothes and bags. As a result, the family can generate more income and it will contribute to the economic prosperity of the region.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Puega

texts.en: Pueaga is a 30-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a small business providing taxi services. She has run this business for many years. Puega needs a loan to purchase new tires and windows for her taxi. She will use her profits to help satisfy her family's everyday needs. Puega joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tires, car windows, and other equipment for her taxi.

loans.name: Seine

texts.en:
Seine is 29 years old. married, and has two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and banana, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Seine is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more chemicals and farming tools to expand her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Seine will use the profits from her sales to save for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, gloves, mist blower, weed killer, and bush knives.

loans.name: Malaga

texts.en: Malaga is a 56-year-old, married woman, who has seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community, to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Malaga needs a loan to buy ingredients and utensils, like flour, sugar, oil, tongs and spoons. She plans to use her profits to extend her business, from pancakes to a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for making pancakes, like flour, sugar, oil, tongs and spoons.

loans.name: Matile

texts.en: Matile is a 48-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She makes and sells donuts, snacks, and drinks in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Matile needs a loan to purchase more goods for her canteen. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's needs, and for the children's education. Matile joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy more things to sell in her canteen, like snacks, soft drinks, ice pops and donuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic goods (rice, salt, mineral water, boxes of sugar, candies).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of coffee and pay shipping charges.

loans.name: Juan Alexander

texts.es: Juan Alexander de 28 anos de edad, soltero sin hijos. Es originario del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente. Chinandega se caracteriza por ser un lugar comercialmente productivo. El tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiene 10 anos de tener el negocio, lo cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante. Negocio que consisten en la compra y venta de mercadería como: camisas, pantalones, faldas, short, camisetas, sandalias, cosméticos, perfumes. La rutina diaria de Juan es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias con un bulto de unos 25 kg para poder entregar su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. Juan ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y aprovechar la temporada navideña donde las ventas se incrementan.  Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Juan Alexander, 28, is single and has no children.  He’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the western zone.  Chinandega is noted for being a commercially productive zone.  His economic activity is selling general merchandise.  He’s been in business ten years and he sells from place to place.  The business consists in buying and selling merchandise like shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, sandals, cosmetics and perfume.  Juan’s daily routine is to work about 10 hours with a bale that weighs about 25 kilos selling to his regular and occasional customers.  Juan has shown responsibility with his payments repaying his previous loans as scheduled.  He needs this loan to invest in working capital to take advantage of the Christmas season when sales increase.  Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jairo Ramon

texts.es: Jairo Ramón de 30 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 5,1 anos. Del departamento de Chinandega lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Jairo tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 7 anos que se dedica a esta actividad. una pulpería es una tienda que vende en pequeñas cantidades productos de consumo diario como sobre de café, sobre se shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, jugos, pan, leche, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frescos naturales, tiste, cuajada, crema, pastas. El negocio surgió con esfuerzos propios y un poco de ahorro propio, por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para los gastos de la casa, ya que no hay fuentes de trabajo fijo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para ofrecer mejor servicio. En un futuro su sueno es construir su dormitorio y terminar de repellar la casa. Jairo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jairo Ramón, 30, is married and has two children who are 5 and 1 years old.  He’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the western part of the country.  Jairo’s economic activity is a home-based ‘pulpería’ he’s had for 7 years.  A pulpería is a store that sells small amounts of basic staples like packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, packets of tomato sauce, juices, bread, milk, rice, beans, sugar, natural beverages, herbal tea, milk curd, cream and pasta.  The business arose by his own efforts and with some savings he had because he needed to have a business to cover household expenses since sources of steady employment do not exist.  He needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock his store and offer better service.  In future, his dream is to build his bedroom and to finish plastering the house.  Jairo is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin” y con la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gallinas y chanchos, ella también se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin”. She raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs. The borrower also sells “chicha de jora” (a traditional beverage made from corn) and beer. She has been in business for several years and has done very well.

The borrower is requesting a loan so that she can buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens. She is a responsible and kind person who wants to move her family forward. The borrower is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Xatinap Quinto Group

texts.es:
La señora Sara Leonarda esta casada, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, se dedica al comercio, específicamente a la venta de cosméticos, inicio este negocio por la situación de no encontrar trabajo y teniendo un poco de capital, hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizaran, para la compra de mercadería, ya que teniendo mas mercadería hay mas posibilidades de vender y mejorar sus ganancias, espera en el futuro tener una tienda de medicamentos naturales. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Leonarda is 30 years old, married, and finished six years of her primary school education. She is in the retail trade, specifically selling cosmetics. Sara started this business because she did not have a job and had little capital. She has four years of experience to date and receives support for her husband, who is a clothing merchant.

Sara organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy merchandise. By having more inventory, she will have more opportunities to sell and improve her earnings. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can sell natural medicines.

The other members of the group are also in the retail trade.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY RUNA”;este banco esta situado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de tamales dulces y salados,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende los tamales en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicito el credito para la compra de insumos como manteca,maiz entre otros para su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “RICCHARY RUNA” communal bank located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She makes sweet and salty tamales and has been doing this for years.  This business is going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts in each day.  She sells the tamales in one of the markets in Cusco and gets her family ahead this way.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as lard and corn among other things for her business.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Palmira Yngerborg

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,lapiz labiales entre otros productos de belleza,la socia trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes personas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas y perfumes.

La socia se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en:
This member continues with her beauty products sales business.  She sells things like creams, perfumes, lipsticks, among other things.  She works independently, delivering her wares to different people and works from 8:00 to 6:00 pm.  She has been in this business for eight years and things are going well.  Her dream is to have a place from where she can sell her beauty products.  She is asking for this loan to buy creams and perfumes.

She is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Niba

texts.en:
She is married and has four children, and all living in a five-room apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division, North West region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, some of which are the death of her child after spending so much money in the hospital, illnesses of her children, inadequate money to provide three square meals daily to her children or to pay for her children's education.

With the new loan, she will expand her business size by buying more foodstuffs, like beans, maize, Irish potatoes and yellow yams. Part of the loan will be reserved to cover transportation of the products, from the bush market to her business site. She believes her business will succeed, because of her longevity in the business, the high demand for foods such as beans and yams in the community, because she has a good business site and has regular customers who buy from her for resale and restaurant purposes. The community will benefit, because they will not have to go a long distance to buy food.

The profits from her business will help her to improve the housing conditions of the family, provide better education and health for the family, and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest cost, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase foods like beans and potatoes, and pay for transporting the produce to her sales location.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma used her previous loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Norma is requesting another loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs. Norma hopes to build a tailoring shop and to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 36 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, es conviviente con Jhon y juntos tienen 3 hijos cuyas edades son 14, 11 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte junto a su pareja el placer de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor.
El negocio de Ana consiste principalmente en brindar servicio de atención a pacientes con alguna dolencia o que requieren de atención médica inmediata o rutinaria. Es una mujer profesional que ha hecho de su carrera una forma de vida ya que considera que la vida y la salud de las personas es lo primordial para seguir adelante. Atiende básicamente a mujeres gestantes en su local que ha establecido para tal fin. Lleva en este negocio más de 2 años y con el tiempo ha ido mejorado la atención gracias a las herramientas y aparatos de laboratorio que ha conseguido poco a poco. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia en el momento que sea necesario. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y poco a poco implementar su local de atención con la adquisición de nuevos implementos de laboratorio para empezar a realizar análisis diversos. 
Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará artículos de asepsia como guantes quirúrgicos, alcohol, algodón, jeringas, y algunas pastillas para malestares leves.
texts.en:
Ana, 36, is a very brave, hardworking woman. She lives together with Jhon and they have three children aged 14, 11 and 2, respectively.  She owns a house where she and her spouse share the joy of raising their children and working hard to provide them the best.  

Ana’s business consists mainly in providing service to patients with some illness or who require immediate or routine medical care.  She’s a professional woman who has made her career her way of life because she considers life and health of people to be fundamental in order to continue forward.

She mainly treats pregnant women in her clinic that’s set up for said purpose.  She’s been in business for more than two years and during this time she’s improved the service thanks to the tools and laboratory equipment she’s gradually acquired.  What she likes about her activity is that it allows her to have time to dedicate to her family whenever necessary.  She hopes to continue working like she’s done to date and gradually equip her clinic acquiring new laboratory equipment so she can start to do various tests.

This is MFP loan #2 and she’s very grateful for the credit opportunity provided and for the financial back-up she needs to continue forward.  She commits to make her monthly payments punctually and to continue working very responsibly with her fellow communal bank members. She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy sterile equipment like surgical gloves, alcohol, cotton, syringes and some pills for minor discomforts.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies.

loans.name: Dolca

texts.es: Dolca, de 47 años, es una mujer amable y muy buena, esta casada con Edwin con quien tiene 4 hijos de 22, 16, 13 y 7 años e edad respectivamente, ellos viven juntos en una casa propia que pudieron comprar en base a mucho trabajo. El trabajo de Dolca, consiste en la compra y venta de madera, compra trozos de los diferentes aserraderos los cuales procesa hasta convertirlos en listones o tablas. Todo lo obtenido lo lleva a su almacén en donde los vende de manera individual, todo este proceso lo realiza en los aserraderos donde obtiene la madera y la venta es en su casa. Lleva trabajando así ya por mas de 20 años y le esta yendo bien. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y actualmente se encuentran implementando su taller de procesamiento para que ellos mismos realicen todo el procedimiento de transformación de la madera y puedan obtener mayores ganancias. Esta muy contenta de que le este yendo bien, ya que tiene un buen margen de ganancias por la madera vendida. Espera poder ampliar su negocio y así pueda tener más ingresos. Este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 3800 soles comprará madera para empezar de nuevo con el proceso de transformación, además comprará una sierra diamantada para que realice cortes perfectos en su pequeño taller.
texts.en:
Dolca, 47, is a kind, very good woman. She’s married to Edwin with whom she has four children who are 22, 16, 13 and 7 years old respectively.  They live together in a house of their own that they were able to buy with much effort.  Dolca’s work consists in buying and selling lumber.  She buys pieces from various sawmills that she processes into slats or boards.  Everything she produces she stores in her warehouse where she sells the lumber individually.  She carries out the entire process in sawmills where she gets the lumber and her sales take place at home.  She’s been working like this for more than 20 years and is doing well.  She works with help from her husband and is currently setting up a processing workshop so that they can do all the wood transformation work themselves and be able to obtain higher profits.

She’s very happy that she’s doing well since he earns a good profit margin on the sold lumber.  She hopes to be able to expand the business so she can earn more income.  This is MFP loan #9 and she’s grateful to those who provide her with the opportunity to access this loan that will give her the security to stay in business.  On the other hand, she once again commits to make her monthly payments punctually.  She will use the requested 3,800 soles to buy lumber to start the transformation process again; she will also buy a diamond tip saw to make perfect cuts in her small workshop.

loans.use: to buy lumber and a saw.

loans.name: Gavy

texts.es: Gavy, de 31 años, es una mujer joven y soñadora, ella es madre de un niño de 4 meses de edad quien es fruto de su relación con Jimmy, su conviviente. Juntos viven en casa de su madre, apoyándose mutuamente y desde ahí todos los días trabajan para ayudar a que el nivel de vida de su familia mejore. El trabajo de Gavy consiste en la decoración de fiestas infantiles. Compra diferentes telas, globos, adornos y otros accesorios que usa para desarrollar su labor. En ocasiones compra los materiales para elaborar todo lo necesario dependiendo del gusto del cliente, del motivo de la fiesta y de la edad de la persona a quien celebraran. Sus clientes llegan a ella por recomendación o por conocimiento del trabajo que realiza. Tiene buen gusto para armar figuras llamativas y eso se refleja en todo el ambiente que crea en los eventos que trabaja. Por lo general trabaja sola. Lleva realizando esta actividad más de 4 años y le va muy bien. Complementa este negocio con la venta de prendas de vestir a crédito o alquilando un mototaxi que compró hace 2 años. Ahora le va muy bien y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la satisfacción que siente al ver el rostro de sus clientes contentos por todo lo que puede crear aún en espacios pequeños, además es un trabajo muy flexible que le permite atender a su pequeño hijo, ahora quiere implementar su negocio con la compra de telas y sillas que se requieren en las fiestas para brindar un mejor servicio y generar otra ganancia por el alquiler de los mismos. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará telas de colores, accesorios decorativos, globos, siliconas y otros materiales que usa para decorar.
texts.en:
Gavy, 31, is a young woman with dreams. She’s the mother of a little four-month-old boy who is the fruit of her relationship with Jimmy, her spouse.  They live together in her mother’s house supporting each other.  They work from there every day to help improve their family’s standard of living.

Gavy’s work consists in decorating for children’s parties.  She buys various fabric, balloons, decorations and other accessories she uses in her work.  On occasion, she buys supplies to make everything needed according to customers’ wishes, the party theme and the age of the person being celebrated.

Her customers come to her either referred or because they are aware of the work she does.  She has very good taste in assembling eye-catching figures and this is reflected in the entire environment she creates for the events she works.  In general, she works alone.  She’s been doing this for more than four years and is doing very well.  She complements this business with selling clothes on credit or leasing out a mototaxi she bought two years ago.  She’s doing very well now and what she likes about her work is the satisfaction she feels when she sees the expressions on her happy customers’ faces for everything she’s able to create even in small spaces.  In addition, it’s a flexible type of work that allows her to care for her little boy.

She now wants to start a business buying fabric and chairs needed for parties to provide better service and generate additional profits by renting same.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy colored fabric, decorative accessories, balloons, silicone and other supplies she uses to decorate.

loans.use: to buy colored fabric, decorations, baloons, silicone and other decorating supplies.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús de 55 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene una hija que ya es mayor de edad e independiente a quien educó y alimentó con mucho amor, vive en su casa junto a su conviviente con quien comparte sus días entre trabajo y momentos de alegría juntos. El trabajo de Jesús consiste en la siembra y cosecha de diversos productos regionales. Es así que todas las semanas se dirige vía fluvial hasta un centro poblado, ahí tiene una chacra destinado a la siembra de diversos productos agrícolas como plátano, maíz, frijol y otros. Los productos cosechados los ofrece a la venta en la bodega que tiene su hija o en el puerto pesquero de la ciudad cuando trae en grandes proporciones. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y recibe la ayuda de su conviviente. Cuando empezó a hacer este trabajo le era un poco complicado ya que no tenia los conocimientos necesarios para poder ser una buena agricultora, pero en base a muchas capacitaciones y deseos de superación pudo lograrlo y ahora su tierra produce productos de buena calidad que son muy solicitados en la ciudad. A parte de tener un buen ingreso también le gusta mucho poder estar entre la naturaleza y ver crecer sus plantas, espera que le siga yendo todo bien y mas adelante poder sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es el crédito numero 4 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará semillas maíz y frejol para poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, otra parte del dinero lo usará para pagar el flete por el transporte de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jesús, 55, is a good, kind woman living with her spouse with whom she has a daughter who is now an independent adult who she fed and schooled with much love.  She lives in her house with her spouse with whom she shares her days between work and joyful moments together.  Jesús’ work consists in growing and harvesting various regional products.  She heads out via river every week to a population center where she has her field where she grows various agricultural products like bananas, corn, beans and others.  The harvested products are sold in a store her daughter has or in the city’s fishing port when she brings greater amounts.  She’s been doing this work for ten years and her spouse helps her.  

When she started doing this work it was a bit complicated because she did not have the required knowledge to be a good farmer but thanks to many training courses and to her wish for self-improvement she was able to attain it and now her land produces good quality products that are highly sought-after in the city.  In addition to earning a good income, she likes being among nature and watching her plants grow.  She hopes she’ll continue doing good and later on be able to plant in larger amounts.

This is MFP loan #4 and she’s grateful to the people who make the financing she needs to reach her goals possible.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually and expects to continue working with her communal bank because of the fellowship and mutual support each of the members has for each other.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy corn and bean seeds to be able to plant larger amounts and will use the other part of the money to pay her products’ shipping costs.

loans.use: to buy corn and broad bean seeds and to pay shipping costs.

loans.name: Sersmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Sersmaa, 62 years old, lives with her family in Orkhon, the third largest city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been retired, and now run an agriculture business by cooperating with a private business entity. Her husband is a member of the board of directors of a private bank. As winter comes to Mongolia, the apartment they live in is getting cold, due to its vulnerable windows and walls. Therefore, she is requesting the loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows and some construction materials. As a result, the family can live comfortably, and the apartment won’t lose its heat any more. Preventing heat loss will not only make the family more comfortable, it will also be beneficial to the environment by reducing the burning of fuel.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows and construction materials, to reduce heat loss from the apartment in which she lives.

loans.name: Pisia

texts.en: Pisia is a 35-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She would like to start growing cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes to earn a living. Pisia has requested a loan to purchase vegetable seeds, other inputs, and farming tools, to use in starting a new business. She has been a member of SPBD for the first year. Pisia will save her profits in her account, for family needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, other inputs, and tools for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 27-year-old, married woman, who has one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Malia has requested a loan to buy a spade, sprayer, bush knives, wheelbarrow, chemicals, etc, for the plantation. She joined SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Malia hopes to build a new house for the family one day.

loans.use: to buy tools and inputs for growing taro, taamu and bananas.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old, married, and has five adult children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Together with her husband, she is engaged in rice farming, which she has been doing for more than 20 years.

Juana is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Analiza requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad to use in her business. Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad to use in her passenger transportation business.

loans.name: Leatulai

texts.en: Leatulai is a 49-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She plans to start a small taxi business.  Leatulai needs a loan to purchase a spare tire, brake and steering fluid. She will use her profits to pay for her kids' education. Leatulai  joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new tire, break fluid, and engine oil.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1962. She has five children. The oldest child is a laborer. The other four are learning, at high school and university. Hoa and her husband raise pigs and chickens to earn a living. They have done this job for 18 years. She gets 2,500,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

Hoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for chickens and pigs. Her dreams are to let her children have good careers, and to enlarge her animal farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Battogtokh

texts.en: Mr. Battogtokh, 41 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a road policeman, while his wife works as a tailor. His home is located about one kilometer away from the main road. In the morning and evening, when he needs to go to work and come back, he needs a car. Now, without a car of his own, he is spending a lot of money paying for taxi rides. So he is requesting the loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy an environmentally-friendly automobile. The automobile will benefit the family by saving their money, and, most importantly, will contribute to environmental protection by emitting less pollution.

loans.use: to buy an environmentally-friendly automobile.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 45 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Liliosa works very hard to provide for them.

Liliosa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells snack foods, sardines, sugar and other items. 

In the future, Liliosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
This is Roy. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used for purchasing equipment for his barber shop. His earnings were a big help with his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy materials like clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials. His profits will definitely help sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Roy dreams of being able to give his family a good future through all his hard work. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials like clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials needed in his barber shop.

loans.name: Ichinnorov

texts.en:
Ichinnorov, 25 years old, lives with her family in Darkhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. In 2010, she graduated from the university with a degree in the engineering of construction materials. She and her husband both work as technologists in the same company. 

In 2012, with her savings, she purchased a one-room apartment. Before purchasing the apartment, the family was living in her brother’s home, so they have no furniture. Also the apartment has been heavily damaged, so she is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to buy construction materials and furniture. By doing so, the couple can live comfortably and can invest in their children’s education without worry.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and furniture.

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tusiga has requested a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to extend her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Tusiga hopes to save for family needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, shovels, chemicals, gloves, and weed killer.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María es socia nueva del banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia Rosa María continua trabajando en un estudio contable,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la Socia a la vez es estudiante de la carrera profesional de contabilidad,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

 
La socia Rosa María solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 
(La socia Rosa María esta vestida de casaca de color celeste y acompañada de su hermana).
texts.en:
Rosa María is a new member of the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. 

Rosa María is still working in an accounting office. She has been doing this work for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort she devotes to it each day. At the same time, she is studying for a professional degree in accounting.  She is a cheerful and responsible person and this is how she is moving forward in life.

Rosa María is applying for the loan in order to pay for her studies.

She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to make her scheduled payments. 

(Rosa María is wearing a light blue jacket and is accompanied by her sister).

loans.use: To pay for post-secondary education.

loans.name: Tuputala

texts.en: Tuputala is 27 years old and married  with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tuputala needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush-knives, aspade, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Tuputala will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and have her own business.

loans.name: Sangilo

texts.ru: Сангило житель города Яван. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. Сангило является отцом четверых детей. Он более двадцати лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. На сегодняшний день Сангило хочет заняться одновременно животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков и коров, чтобы начать этот вид деятельности.
texts.en:
Sangilo is a resident of the city of Yavan. He is 58 years old and married. Sangilo is the father of four children. He has been engaged in field crop cultivation for more than twenty years. 

Currently Sangilo would like to also work with livestock breeding. He takes a loan for the purchase of bulls and cows, in order to start this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and bulls

loans.name: Ilhomidin

texts.ru:
Илхомиддин  1983 года рождения. Он женат  и имеет одного ребенка.   Илхом с самого детства занимается животноводством, этому его научили родители.  Он очень трудолюбивый и ответственный  молодой мужчина.   
    Так как Илхомиддин занимается только животноводством он старается развивать свой бизнес.   В прошлом году из-за повышения цен на корм, он продал часть своего скота, так как нужно было прокормить скот.  А в этом году он теперь хочет купить скот так как он сам выращивает корм. Супруга его не имеет высшего образования и в свободное от воспитания детей  времени, помогает мужу.
 На полученный кредит   Илхом планирует приобрести скот и увеличить поголовье скота.   Илхом очень благодарен  организации Кива за финансовую поддержку  и планирует дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Ilhomidin was born in 1983. He is married and has one child. Since childhood Ilhomidin has worked with livestock breeding, which his parents taught him. He is a very hardworking and responsible young man. 

As Ilhomidin only works with livestock breeding, he tries to develop his business. Because of higher prices for fodder last year, he sold part of his herd as it was necessary to feed the livestock. This year, he would like to purchase livestock as he grows fodder himself. His wife does not have higher education and in her spare time, when she does not take care of the children, she helps her husband. 

For the loan received, Ilhomidin plans to purchase livestock and increase the number of animals. Ilhomidin is very thankful to Kiva for the financial support and plans for further cooperation.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as sugar, soap, bread, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom was born in 1975. She has two children who are learning at secondary school and high school. Her husband and she raise chickens to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 dong [VND]. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,048,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to buy food for the chickens. She wants to raise her children well and enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 28, has worked from a young age to sell home products, such as plates, mugs, and utensils. Her earnings contribute to the household expenses. She began working with a small capital from her husband; thanks to her determination, she has established a well-stocked business. She works every day, selling her merchandise at the market, where she has a small space. Her medium-term goal is to set up a store to sell her products, and to add clothing to what she offers for sale.

Currently she wants to expand her stock for the holiday season, so she is requesting a loan to buy stock, which will include utensils and other household items. This way, she will have a wide variety for her customers to choose from.

Her biggest desire is to become a successful micro-entrepreneur, able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock for the holiday season, which will include utensils and other household items

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1957. He has two children, who are adults. They are a carpenter and a salesman. His wife sells insurance. Dung raises chickens to earn a living. His income is about 2,500,000 dong [VND]. He has done this work for 25 years. His family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Dung has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, he borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, he would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for chickens. He always wants to enlarge his poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Veronique est une jeune femme de 34 ans célibataire, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 12 ans. deux de ses enfant vont déjà à l'école. elle a ouvert et gère une boutique de vente emportée de boissons depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. son activité fonctionne mais elle manque souvent de stock parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité parce que son capital ne lui permet pas de faire autrement. Elle est obligée à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer un nouveau. D'où son besoin de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter des casiers de boisson . Le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir la devanture de sa structure, d'agrandir aussi. Elle économisera le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Veronique is a young 34 year old single woman, and mother to 3 children whose ages range from 3 to 12 years old. Two of her children already go to school. She opened and has been managing a shop selling imported drinks for 2 years in a neighborhood of the capital. Her business functions but she often lacks stock because she buys in small quantities because her capital doesn't allow her to do otherwise. She is obliged each time to sell all her stock to be able to get herself a new one. Thus her need for his loan which will allow her to increase her cases of drinks. The profits that this loan will bring her will help her to expand the shop front of her structure, and also to expand. She will save the rest for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cases of drinks.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида 27 года, не замужем. Аида по характеру очень веселая девушка. Её оптимизму и доброжелательности нету границ. Соседи Аиды отзываются о ней как о отзывчивой и старательной девушки. После школы Аида закончила средне технический лицей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Аида начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS) в 2006 году, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от  перепродажи скота и продажи молока. Благодаря упорному труду Аида, ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 голов быков и 1 корова. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 голов бычков по более низкой цене. Доходы Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах в осуществить свою давнюю мечту, приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en:
