* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rafuncelis a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17000 PHP through NWTF to buy more shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, and other items to sell in her general store. 

Rafuncel has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Rafuncel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store,

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 62 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lily is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

Lily has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (in the photo) is a scarf weaver. Her husband, Nen is a farmer and does construction work when he is free. 

The couple has been married since 2008 and they have no children yet. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vutha had asked for Kiva loan (www.kiva.org/lend/369991). She is now asking for another in the amount of 1,000 to help fund capital for her husband farming business. He will repair his water pumping machine because the old one is breaking and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to fund her husband's business so he can repair his water pump and buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Arante

texts.en:
Arante is a 34 year old married man and a father of three young children from Ubay, Bohol.  He earns a living through his fishing ventures.
Arante is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets.  With a loan, he will be able to improve his fishing business.
In the future, Arante dreams of expanding his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets

loans.name: Joelisa

texts.en:
Joelisa is a 34 year old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than ten years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Joelisa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta has seven brothers and a sister. Although some of her older siblings have left the house, she still lives with her parents and five siblings. Between the eight of them, they live on $16 a day. Violeta’s parents only had the opportunity to receive a primary education and with low paying jobs in construction, higher education is not in their budget. Desperate for a better life Violeta works 30 hours a week in order to pay her tuition. She is passionate about finance because she sees it as a growing field in Bolivia and a career with a great future. With the money from this loan Violeta plans on buying a computer and her school books. She spends much her free time working, and during the small time she has to study, Violeta works hard to fit in all the new material. Having a laptop will allow her to not only better manage her time but also understand finance better. Violeta calls Bolivia “a country in development.” With a degree and a career in finance she feels she will be prepared for a new era in Bolivia. Moving from earning $9 a day to $14 will allow Violeta to help her family and invest in her future.

loans.use: to pay for a computer and books she needs to graudate

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson’s dream is to become a chemical engineer. He is currently enrolled in a university program but is struggling because he cannot afford to buy the necessary materials for his courses. Growing up with six brothers and 3 sisters his family of 10 always struggled with their finances. Both his parents are farmers and as such their income is often seasonal or dependent on the harvest. Nelson has another sibling in university, a further strain on his family’s resources. He works part time to contribute, but only takes home around $3 a day. The chemical engineering field is growing in Bolivia and Nelson is expecting to earn around $16 a day when he finds a job in this field. With this in his future, Nelson is anxious to finish school and begin working. With this income increase he could help his younger siblings go to school and together they could pull their family out of poverty.

loans.use: the books he needs to finish his courses

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes tiene 26 años de edad, casada tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 7  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de la Circunvalación, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. El la foto la Sra. Mercedes esta acompañado de su esposo.
texts.en: Mercedes, 26, is married and has a 7-year-old son.  She sells stationery supplies, office supplies, books, etc.  She sells a wide variety of goods according to the season.  Her general/book store is located in the Circunvalación zone.  She lives in the family home and is asking for a loan to stock up on school supplies for her bookstore-general store since she does very well in that the store is well-located and sales are good.  She’s a person who makes her payments, is responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support provided.  In the photo, Mercedes’ husband appears with her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her bookstore.

loans.name: Ingris Sudelvia

texts.es:
Doña ingris es comerciante de zapatos de adultos y niños por catálogos, su forma de vender es ambulante de casa en casa por encargos, también tiene clientes en algunas instituciones del gobierno como el ministerio de familia y de educación.
Ella inicia en esta actividad comercial para ayudar a cooperar con los gastos del hogar, y de esta forma a presupuestar las necesidades de primera necesidad junto con su compañero de vida.
Tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos en edad escolar.
Actualmente necesita capital de trabajo para adquirir un pedido de zapatos con los que se proyecta en atender algunos encargos de sus clientes.
Ella es una persona responsable y con deseos de superación personal.
texts.en: Ingris sells shoes for adults and children via catalogue.  She sells door to door from place to place on order; she also has some customers in a few government institutions like the family and education ministries.  She started this commercial activity in order to contribute towards household expenses and be able to budget for basic needs with her life companion.  She has three children one of which is school age.  She currently needs working capital to pay for an order of shoes she plans to use to fill some pending customer orders.  She’s a responsible person with a strong drive towards personal improvement.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Paula se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas suaves su crédito lo invirtió en compra de maíz, leña y cal ingredientes necesarios para el producto final, tiene treinta y seis años de edad y es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares. 
Lleva dieciséis años ejerciendo dicha actividad su negocio se ubica en una calle céntrica lo que le favorece para vender todos su producto elaborados. 
Es importante mencionar que su tiempo es aprovechado al máximo ya que por la mañana trabaja como asistente del hogar (DOMESTICA) con lo cual lleva un poco mas de ingreso para la unidad familiar y poder hacerle frente a sus obligaciones. Por lo que prácticamente solo las tardes le quedan para hacer sus tortillas de maíz.
texts.en: Paula works making soft tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder, ingredients needed for her final product.  She’s 36-years-old and the mother of two school age children.  She’s been in said activity for 16 years and her business is located in a centrally located street which is favorable for selling all she makes.  It’s important to mention that she uses her time to the maximum because she works as a domestic employee mornings earning a little extra for her family and to be able to fill her obligations so she’s only able to make corn tortillas in the afternoon.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en: Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. To make a living, Aracelle runs a retail store. Aracelle engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aracelle is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods, sugar and coffee. In 2010, Aracelle joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jackelinne Benita

texts.es: La señora Jackelinne sigue con la misma actividad ella tiene una licoreria cuenta que le fue bien con el credito crecio en su actividad y en esta ocacion solicita el prestamos para la compra de vino y cidras por mayor por estas fechas de fin de año hay mucha demanda de estos productos y ella desea abastecerse y asi tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Señora Jackelinne is keeping on with the same business; she has a small liquor store.  She says that everything went well with the last loan and she was able to grow her business.  This time she is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale wine and ciders for the end of the year.  There is a lot of demand for those products and she wants to be well stocked so she can earn a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wine and ciders.

loans.name: Franklin José

texts.es:
El Sr. Franklin a sus treinta y cuatro años de edad es docente de educación primaria de un centro escolar de san Rafael del sur, en dicha actividad lleva un poco más de quince años, este y todos sus créditos han sido para mejoras en su casa ya que con los crédito otorgados por kiva es que ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda.  
Es importante mencionar que anteriormente su casa las paredes eran de laminas de zinc y con sus créditos ha logrado tener una casa más confortable con paredes de bloques y pisos de cerámica.
texts.en:
Franklin is 34 years old and has been a professor of primary education in a school in san Rafael del sur for a little more than 15 years.

This and all of his loans have been for improvements to his home. With the loan granted by Kiva, he has managed to improve his home.

It is important to mention that his previous house had walls made of zinc sheets. With his loans, he has managed to have a more comfortable home with block walls and tile floors.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement, blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Las Chamacas Group

texts.es:
Grupo perseverante de mujeres con espíritu joven. Han permanecido fieles a su compromiso de crecimiento financiero para seguir ofreciendo un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Ana Verónica, mujer, esposa y madre de dos hijos, es un ejemplo de ellas. Ella inicio la venta de artículos de limpieza aproximadamente hace tres años enfocada solo a la solo a la materia prima. Después de este tiempo, a decidido a comprometerse con un nuevo crédito para comprar materia prima como: aluminio, madera, tornillos; y generar equipos de soporte para complementar los artículos de limpieza. 
Ella esta convencida que este nuevo producto en su negocio inyectara y atraerá más clientes y con ello ampliaran su mercado.
texts.en:
This is a group of persevering women with a young spirit.They have remained faithful to their commitment of financial growth to continue to provide a better future for their families.

Ana Verónica, woman, wife, and mother of two, is an example of them. She started selling cleaning supplies approximately three years ago focused only on the raw material. After this time, she decided to commit herself to a new loan to purchase raw materials like aluminum, wood and screws, and generate support teams to complement the cleaning supplies.

She is convinced this new product will increase her business and attract more customers, and thereby expand her market.

loans.use: to invest in raw material for carpentry to generate support teams for cleaning products.

loans.name: Amigas De Laura Caller Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el  grupo Amigas de Laura Caller

Este grupo está emprendiendo su primer ciclo, son 06 socias que se conocen entre sí. Elizabeth es la presidenta del grupo ella  tiene 35 años, es casada con 07 hijos; actualmente tiene a su cargo a 4 de sus hijos los mayores ya son independientes, hace 10 años empezó su propio negocio con el único fin de ayudar a su esposo con el sustento de su familia. Elizabeth trabaja vendiendo ropa de niños los artículos que ofrece van desde medias, ropas interiores y zapatos. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado donde ofrece sus productos a toda su clientela, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio con la compra de diversos artículos para niños como ropa y calzado, en el futuro le gustaría abrir otra tienda con el mismo rubro. Elizabeth está muy agradecida por el préstamo para su grupo comunal, especialmente a EDAPROSPO y a los Inversionistas de todo el mundo.
Elizabeth aparece en la foto con polo blanco y pantalón azul
La sra.que viste polo color turqueza es una invitada del grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. This is the Amigas de Laura Caller Group. 

This group is beginning its first cycle. There are six members who know each other. 

Elizabeth is the president of the group. She is 35 years old, and is married with seven children. Currently she has responsibility for four of her children, as the older ones are already independent. She began her own business ten years ago in order to help her husband support the family.

Elizabeth works selling children’s clothing offering articles ranging from stockings to underwear and shoes. She has a stand at the market where she offers her products to all her customers.

The money from the loan will be used to improve her business with the purchase of diverse articles for children such as clothing and shoes. In the future she would like to open another store with the same items.

Elizabeth is very grateful for the loan for her communal group, especially to EDAPROSPO and the loaners from around the world.

Elizabeth appears in the photo with the white polo and blue pants. 

The lady wearing the turquoise polo is a guest of the group.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cruz esta casada, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los grado de diversificado, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de sus suegros y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y así mejorar su producción de tejido de cortes, espera que a través del préstamo va a mejorar su trabajo y sus ganancias. En el futuro quiere tener mas trabajadores.
texts.en:
Maria Cruz is 26 years old and married. She studied diverse subjects. She has 3 children, none of which are in school. She is dedicated to working with typical cuts of fabric. She started this business with the support of her in-laws, and so far has 8 years of experience. She has the support of her husband who supports her financially.

She requests a loan that will be used to purchase different colors of yarn, thus improving her production of textile cuts. She hopes to improve her work and her earnings through the loan. In the future she would like to have more workers.

loans.use: to buy yarn for fabrics.

loans.name: Las Forjadoras De Villa Del Norte Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!  Este  el grupo Las Forjadoras de Villa Del Norte

Este grupo es nuevo, son 5 amigas que lo conforman, una de las socias es la Sra. Delia de 43 años. Ella es divorciada y vive con sus 02 hijos. Delia se dedica a diferentes oficios, en su casa tiene una bodega donde vende toda clase de productos de primera necesidad, también alquila una parte de su casa como cochera donde los comerciantes del  mercado  guardan sus carretas, gracias a los ingresos que percibe puede darle a sus hijos una buena educación y sustentar los gastos básicos que su familia requiere. Delia siempre quiso tener un negocio propio para no descuidar a sus hijos y se siente feliz de haber logrado su sueño, ahora quiere continuar trabajando para mejorar  su bodega y surtirla con mas productos, el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le otorgara lo invertirá básicamente en la compra de productos navideños en especial panetones y chocolates, en estas fiestas navideñas las ventas aumentan por eso quiere abastecerse de estos productos para poder satisfacer a su clientela.
Delia quiere agradecer a todos los inversionistas por apoyar a su grupo Comunal, en la foto ella viste polo color azul.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is called Las Forjadoras de Villa Del Norte.

This group is new. Five friends formed it. One of the members is Delia who is 43 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children.

Delia is engaged in different trades. She has a store in her home where she sells all types of staples. She also rents a part of her home such as the garage where the market traders keep their carts.Thanks to the income she gets she can provide her children with a good education and cover the basic household costs her family requires.

Delia always wanted to have her own business so as to not neglect her children and feels happy to have achieved her dream. Now she wants to continue working to improve her store and stock it with more products. The loan that EDAPROSPO will provide her will be invested in the purchase of special Christmas products such as panettones and chocolates.

During the holiday season sales increase and that’s why she wants to stock these products in order to be able to satisfy her customers.

Delia wants to thank all the loaners for supporting her communal group. In the photograph she is wearing a blue polo.

loans.use: to buy panettones and chocolates

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, which is taken inside his store.

Laila is a 20-year-old married woman. For the past three years, Laila's husband has had a small cosmetics store located in a busy area in Jabalia's market. This store contains several beauty products such as hair products, face and hair creams. This project is considered to be a very successful one, but it needs more support to cover costs.

Laila took a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband buy more cosmetic products for the store. This loan will help the family to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Hendrick

texts.en: Hendrick lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with six children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after her grandchildren and elderly mother. She has been operating a food stall selling fresh peas and beans for five years, working six days a week. She also sells local brew as another source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy baskets of fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes and green peppers to sell at her stall. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate profits to buy land and start growing peas and beans. She joined MCDT SACCO because of group lending and the weekly repayment schedule. She lives in a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes and green peppers to sell at her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en: Lupe is 24 years old.  She is married and has three children. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava (traditional skirt) or elei. In order to do this, Lupe needs a loan to purchase ie lavalava, paints, brush and design board to start her new elei. She hopes to use her profits to save for the kids' education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy paints, design board, paint brush,.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 30 years old. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past seven years.  This business has enabled her to provide food for her family. Francine needs a loan in order to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is planning to celebrate Christmas with her family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Senh

texts.en:
Senh was born in 1948. She has five children. They are building workers and carpenters. She and her husband sell rice cakes to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy ingredients to make rice cakes and to sell them. She always wants to save enough money for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make rice cakes to sell.

loans.name: Sinavaimalama

texts.en: Sina is 30 years old.  She is married and has five children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Sina  needs a loan to purchase more chemicals, vegetable seeds and a wheelbarrow to extend her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Sina will use the profits from her sales to save for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling eggs. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional trisikad.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has three children. She sells various types of merchandise and has been in the business for one year. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal, cooking oil and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To add more charcoal, cooking oil and maize for sale.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: For this loan cycle, Clara is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her store.  The native mat-making business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues to provide for her and her family with an income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with four children, all of whom are attending school. His wife is a businesswoman. For the last two years, Hamisi has been operating a general store, selling basic grains, food stuffs, and cleaning products, among other items. It has been a profitable project since it has given him good results.

For the last few weeks, demand has risen and he wants to take advantage of this. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of  20,000 KES to add stock of flour, cooking oil, basic grains, and medicines.

Hamisi desires to expand his business to a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, cooking oil, basic grains, and medicines.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 54 year old widow with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Erlinda has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah  is married with six children, three of whom are dependents. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and paying utility bills. 

Deborah  has been in the fish selling business for three years, and sells to all categories of people on retail. She doesn’t have any other side income.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish.  She works seven days every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to help her with transportation.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Kokab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kokab is a 31-year-old, married woman and the mother of two daughters and one son.  She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare.  Her husband is employed in a small restaurant.  His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.  

She started her business to contribute to the family income.  She has been in the sewing business for many years, and is very familiar with the stitching techniques.  She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation, and used her first loan to buy a sewing machine.  At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons and needles, so that she can meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different colored thread, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy catering products (crates of eggs, small café materials, spaghetti and cases of drinks).

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida earns a living through her retailing business. She sells ready-to-wear clothes and accessories to the people in her area in San Miguel, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like shirts, pants, slippers and other items. In the future, Leonida hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her six children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shirts, pants, slippers and other items

loans.name: Zainab Y.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 13,800,000 Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they will be empowered to meet their immediate financial needs and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Lansana is the leader and featured member of this group. He is a native of Faama village in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple have 7 children: 3 in primary school, 1 in secondary school, and 3 in college. Fifty-six year old Lansana has been a professional teacher for 32 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, sand, cement, rods, etc. so he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a house

loans.name: Bouweh

texts.en:
She is married with three children and lives in a two-room apartment house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon.

She has encountered so many difficulties in life, including inadequate finances to pay tuition fees for her children.  Because of this, the children are constantly being driven out of classes for the late payment of school fees and not having school supplies like pens, pencils, exercise books and text books.  She has also been facing a great challenge with her children in her husband's house due to marital problems including her husband’s family members, the death of her father, the ill health of her mother and the inability to provide three square meals to her family each day.

With the new loan, she will improve her documentation business by buying a modern photocopier and papers for photocopying.  She will also buy cosmetics like rubbing oil, lotions, bathing soaps and body treatments that are in high demand in her locality.  She believes her business will succeed because of her expertise, the activity is in high demand in her community, she has a strategic business site near a school so students always photocopy papers from her, and she has good marketing skills in approaching new customers and maintaining old ones.  The activity will benefit the people in the community because they will not need to go long distances to photocopy papers, photocopies will be made at a very moderate rate and the cosmetic products will be sold to them at reduced prices.

The profits will help her improve the housing conditions of her family, provide them with better education and healthcare, and expand her business.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to pay for a photocopier and cosmetics for re-sale.

loans.name: Mwamvumbo

texts.en:
Mwamvumbo, 43, is married and has six children.  He lives with all of his family in Tiribe which is in Coast Province, Kenya.  Mwamvumbo describes himself as a tranquil, unassuming person with a desire for self-improvement.

He works as a retailer and sells mattresses.  This is the second loan he has asked for from Yehu.  He will use it to buy more mattresses which will help him increase his merchandise and meet his customer demands.  This business helps Mwamvumbo to increase his income which helps him support his family.  His dream is to stay in business with his family and, in the future, be able to open more businesses.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia 
Grecia 
C 600.000

Ligia tiene 42 años de edad vive con 2 hijos y su esposo, además cuida a una nieta en la ciudad de Grecia, en la provincia de Alajuela.  Mujer emprendedora, trabajo en Norte América para apoyar el estudio de su hija que ahora es una profesional en leyes. Adquierió capital con el que construye un taller, ya que siempre ha trabajado en costura. Se asocia con la señora  Lucia a quien le confecciona uniformes para grupos de ejercicios y trae mercadería de Estados Unidos que comercializa en la zona y en lugares aledaños. Independiente y trabajadora.

 Trabajo en Estados Unidos, donde con ahorro y adquirió maquinaria y mejoró las condiciones del taller. Solicita el préstamo para adquirir una maquina especial para dar un mejor acabado a la ropa y comprar materia prima para el trabajo con la empresa SEV (Salud, Estética y Vida) de confección de uniformes. La actividad cuenta con un patrimonio importante, maneja 2 negocios que le generan ingresos fijos, desea mejorar la calidad de su producto adquiriendo una máquina especial.

Ella se levanta temprano a organizar su casa, a media mañana se dedica a cortar las telas para elaborar las prendas en la tarde y durante la noche se dedica a cobrar y vender la ropa. Desea darle el estudio a su hijo para que se convierta en profesional al igual que su hija mayor.

 Cuenta con maquinaria y equipo para su trabajo, clientela donde coloca su producto y espera darle un mejor acabado con el equipo que va a adquirir. Tiene amplia experiencia en la costura y además los contactos en Estados Unidos le permiten tener el negocio de venta de ropa donde trae mercadería de calidad obteniendo un margen de ganancia importante.
texts.en:
Ligia 
Grecia 
600,000 CRC

Ligia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, in addition to caring for a granddaughter, in the city of Grecia in the province of Alajuela. She is a hardworking woman who worked in North America in order to support her daughter's studies. Now her daughter is a legal professional. She acquired some capital with which she built a workshop as she has always worked as a dressmaker. She has a business partner, Lucia, with whom she makes uniforms for exercise groups. She brings merchandise from the United States and sells it in her community as well as in neighboring communities. She is independent and hardworking.   

She worked in the United States where she saved up, bought equipment and improved her workshop conditions. She is requesting a loan to buy a special sewing machine to give her clothing a nicer finish and to buy basic materials for a job with the SEV (Salud, Estética y Vida) company making uniforms. The business has important assets. She runs two business that generate fixed incomes. She hopes to improve the quality of her product by purchasing a special sewing machine. 

She gets up early to get the house together. By mid-morning she is cutting the fabric to make garments and in the afternoon and evenings she takes orders and sells the clothing. She hopes to be able to give her son an education so that he will become a professional like his older sister.

She has the machinery and equipment for her business and customers to sell her products to. She hopes to be able to give her product a better finish with the equipment she will purchase. She has a lot of experience in dressmaking as well as contacts in the United States that allow her to have a business selling clothing in which she brings quality merchandise making a significant profit margin.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and basic materials to make garments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plantains for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 42 year old married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for almost ten years. 
Lorna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Lorna hopes of expanding their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 48 years old. She lives in the Kobuleti district with her husband and three children. Makvala is a tailor and gets a monthly income. As the existing income isn’t enough for five-member family Makvala decided to start a trading business. She has requested a loan from local credit providers to start a business, but her loan requests were always rejected because of lack of experience in a new business.  

Her loan request was approved under the guidelines of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans for business start-up and re-start up to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit. They are often regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the credit Makvala will purchase clothing and gifts and set up a store. She hopes that her project will be profitable as there is not a similar store nearby. Makvala will gradually increase the sales volume and turnover.  The living conditions of her family will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and gifts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman and a mother of two grown children. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has run a motorcycle repair shop with her husband for several years.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy more material for motorcycle repair like fluids, nuts and bolts, screw drivers and more. With this, they will be able to cater to more customers in their repair shop.

In the future, Lydia hopes of improving their business.

loans.use: to buy material for motorcycle repair like fluids, nuts and bolts, screw drivers and more

loans.name: Anabel De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Anabel es comerciante de ropa usada, actividad de negocio que en Nicaragua ha tenido una gran aceptación por lo accesible en sus precios.
Tiene cinco años de vender este producto, y lo realiza de forma ambulante de casa en casa.
Debido a que su negocio ha contribuido a generar ingresos importantes para sufragar los gastos del hogar y por la experiencia que ha adquirido durante estos cinco años de ejercer este oficio, necesita aumentar su negocio con un préstamo que le permita diversificar su actividad comercial y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo en edad escolar y necesita el empuje económico para su idea de negocio.
texts.en:
Anabel sells used clothing, which has become a good business in Nicaragua and has been well accepted because of the good prices.

She’s been doing this for five years and sells on foot from door to door.  Her business has allowed her to generate an important income that has helped defray the household expenses and, because of her experience, she needs to grow the business with the help of a loan.  This will allow her to diversify and provide better service to her customers.

She is a single mother and has one school-aged son to care for.  She needs a financial boost for her business idea.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata de 43 años comparte una vida conyugal con Alejandro de 41 años, sus hijos ya mayores son la muestra de que con trabajo la buena responsabilidad es posible a pesar tener recursos básicos se puede llegar a brindarles una educación de calidad. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Tiene la trascendencia familiar de dedicarse al campo de forma permanente manteniendo a lo largo de muchos años las técnicas y costumbres que fue heredando. Es así, que hace 20 años logró adquirir su propia parcela en donde viene dedicándose a la producción de café orgánico.
Se siente muy a gusto por seguir la costumbre familiar puesto que muestra un orgullo único de ser la futura heredera de las parcelas que su familia siempre trabajó. Al iniciarse una nueva campaña cafetera ha notado que es necesario realizar una limpieza de maleza a sus plantaciones puesto que es uno de los factores que influyen en la obtención de la calidad de granos. Por otro lado desea contar con sacos de abono orgánico para optimizar la producción.
Desea a futuro aperturar una tienda de abarrotes debido a que es consiente que las misma fuerza y energía que requieren las actividades en el campo no son eternas y es bueno abrirse de diversas maneras en el rubro comercial. Este es su préstamo número 14, muy orgullosa manifiesta que ha logrado superar muchos inconvenientes gracias a los préstamo otorgados. Es una socia muy participativa en su banco comunal puesto que esta atenta a los acuerdos que se toman y trata de mostrar siempre su punto de vista a manera de tomar acuerdos concretos.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado a la contrata de jornaleros para un adecuado deshierbo de maleza sobre sus plantaciones cafeteras y la adquisición de sacos con abono orgánico, muy esenciales para una producción eficiente.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 43, is married to Alejandro, 41. Their children, now grown, are the proof that with work and responsibility, it is possible to provide a quality education, even with basic resources. They live in a wooden house. She has the family tradition of working in the fields on a permanent basis, maintaining over many years the techniques and customs that were inherited. This is how, 20 years ago, she was able to acquire her own parcel of land where she works producing organic coffee. She is very pleased to carry out the family tradition, because she has the unique satisfaction in being the future inheritor of the land that her family always worked.

Upon starting a new coffee growing season, she has noticed that the plantings require weeding, since this is one of the factors that influences the quality of the coffee beans. She also wants sacks of organic manure to optimize production. In the future, she wants to open a grocery store, because she knows that the strength and energy that working in the field requires will not last forever. It is good to have various trade options.

This is her 14th loan. She proudly says that she has been able to overcome many obstacles thanks to the loans she has been given. She is very active in her communal bank, given that she pays attention to the agreements she makes and always tries to show her point of view when making specific agreements. With the 500 new soles, she will add to the money allocated to hire workers for an adequate weeding of her coffee plantings and to buy sacks of organic manure, which are very important to an efficient production.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the rubber plantation county in Liberia.  She is married and a high school graduate.  Since her husband’s nursing job in the local clinic provides little income, she is determined to make their lives better by engaging in a small provision shop.  Mamie has been in this business for twelve years now and enjoys the flow of her customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her shop (rice, oil, pepper, etc.).  Her dream is to become an international businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her shop (rice, oil, pepper, etc.).

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five children, one who is attending school.  She also takes care of grandchildren and elderly parents.  She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years.  In addition to this, she also generates additional income from renting rooms.  

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She works seven days a week from home and sells wholesale to all categories of people.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves due to her location in the slums.  She aspires to build more rental rooms and to buy a delivery van to aid transportation.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en: Iemaima is a 40 year old married woman with two children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.Iemaima has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, a wheel barrow and wires.  She became a member of SPBD in 2012.  Iemaima hopes to use her profits to pay her children's education fees.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, a wheel barrow and wires

loans.name: Lopeta

texts.en: Lopeta is a 62-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lopeta has requested a loan to improve her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Lopeta hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy timber, roofing, nails, cement, and tiles

loans.name: Umaro's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  This group of teachers has come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 7,800,000 Leones for the entire team.  Umaro, the featured leader, has requested a loan in order to pay school fees for his children.  Umaro is a 54-year-old native of the Mateboi village and has been a professional teacher for 30yrs.  He is married to a nurse and has 4 children, 3 in primary school and 1 in college.  

With this loan the group will be able to meet their immediate financial needs and will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.  The school’s bursar is directly responsible for deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay education fees for his children.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to have enough stock for her kiosk.

Mbodze is a determined woman who always looks for opportunities to progress in life. The previous loan had a great positive impact on her living standards. With this new investment, she will add stock of flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, 55, is a married woman with seven children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for several years now.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fuel for the boat and to pay for school fees. In the future, Margarita aims to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fuel for the boat and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 48 year old widow. She has been running a business of cloth trade for many years at her home. She started her business with just a few cotton cloths and over time she has become famous in her community for providing good quality cloths. She offers various types including linen, silk and cotton.

Being a single parent of nine children, she is responsible to provide them with the basic necessities of life. Three of her children are also working to contribute to the family income. In order to purchase more variety of cloths for the winter season, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). She expects a boost in her net income through her large sales. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the bright future of her children. Her children feel proud of their mother.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (plantains, boxes of tomatoes, bananas).

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela  tiene 38 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 5, 7, 9 y 12 años, ella se dedica al tejido de chompas  desde hace ya varios años, su domicilio se encuentra  en el Zona Mariscal Santa cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Marcela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina bordadora  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para la compra de esta máquina que mucha falta le hacen,  la señora  Marcela desea con el tiempo abrir una tienda propia para exponer sus tejidos ya que ahora entrega en los distintos mercados de la Ciudad y de la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela, 38, is married and has four children, ages 5, 7, 9, and 12.  She has made a living knitting sweaters for several years.  Her house is located in the Mariscal Santa Cruz area.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  Marcela's going to use this loan to buy an embroidery machine.  She's requesting the loan because she doesn't have enough money to buy the machine.

In time Marcela wants to open her own store to show her textiles because now she sells in the various markets in the city and the area.  She's going to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad del lavado de arena le fue bien con el anterior credito cuenta que compro el terreno se siente feliz, ahora solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas para realizar su trabajo de mejor manera ya que estan muy gastadas  y esto afecta ya que no le permite realizar un buen trabajo.
texts.en: Juan continues to work in the same field, sand blasting.  Things went well for him with the previous loan and he bought land so he’s happy.  Now he’s asking for a loan to buy tools to do his work in a more efficient manner. His current tools are worn out and this affects his ability to do good work.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
These hard working Tribal women call themselves by the group name “Ruth”. They all live in S. Laijang village in the state of Manipur which is in the North Eastern part of India. They formed the group in 2009, with an aim to generate income for themselves by accessing a loan.

Channu is one of the 10 members of the group and is pictured with raised hand. She is 30 years old and is a mother to three daughters. Two of her older daughters are studying at their intermediate grade in a private school nearby. Channu's husband is a hired auto-rickshaw driver, a kind of transportation ferrying passengers in and around the area. Channu’s previous activity before the loan was cultivating potatoes using the "jhuming" method of cultivation. Her activity could not be of much significance for supplementing the family income. Therefore she decided to open a general store for which reason she joined the group.

With her first loan in 2009, Channu opened a store of her own. She sells general items such as sugar, tea leaves, spices, salt, soap, toothbrushes, etc. With her second loan and with her profits she was able to expand her store by increasing her inventory. She is happy that she doesn’t have to wait for her husband’s return when the children need money for their school requirements such as pens, pencils, notebooks and so on. Now she manages the daily needs of the family with her income and save her husband daily earnings down to a rupee. 

The family plans to buy an auto-rickshaw of their own for better income in the near future. Channu, along with her husband, means to provide a good environment and create a sound family atmosphere for the children's education.  Now she needs another loan for her store business. She wishes to increase her stock in her general store. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members too need another loan for their respective income-generating activities. Potato cultivation, cabbage cultivation, cow rearing, piggery and poultry farming are some of the activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in her general store, such as rice, dal (lentils), sugar, milk powder, various kinds of soap, lightbulbs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 40-year-old Lebanese man.  He’s married, living with his family composed of his wife and two children attending school. He is looking to satisfy the family needs and respond to their demands with the cooperation of his wife, an adorable and supportive woman. 

Antoine started his own business in 1998. He works independently in the construction field and has more than a few projects to be accomplished. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required construction equipment that will allow him to carry on his work properly.  He is sure that in a short period of time he will be able to gain a fair number of clients and move out of the country, taking on bigger projects with higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase required construction equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali, a Lebanese married man. He’s 28 years old. Since his marriage, Ali has lived with his wife and two children. He was the one responsible for everything, especially covering their costs and expenses.  However, Ali doesn’t hesitate to offer his family whatever they ask for.  This is why he decided to start his own business. He opened his own mobile phone shop in 2010. He also sells recharge cards as extra earnings.

 In parallel, he serves in the internal security forces. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, and many other items. This Kiva loan will certainly increase his sales thus his profits. This is why Ali works every day to build a good future, hoping to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase added supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, and many other items

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and five children; one of them is working.  Mohammad’s family joins forces, trying to be supportive just to help him covering the heavy costs of life. Mohammad has eighteen years of experience in the agriculture field and started to work on his own tractor in 1997. He works on a free-lance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. 

Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his tractor and purchase new tires. He notes that this will develop his business and boost his returns.  In the future, he plans to buy a modern tractor and better develop his business.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his tractor and purchase new tires

loans.name: Ngwele

texts.en:
Ngwele is married and blessed with one child, who is below the age of fifteen.  They live in a three-room apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of Northwest Cameroon.  She has faced some challenges in life including the death of her sister, the illness of her mother, and the inadequate capital to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Ngwele has a business making dresses.  With this loan she plans to buy more material for the smooth running of her business (traditional wear, threads, equipment), and the rest of the loan will be reserved to facilitate the function of the business.  She believes that her business will succeed because of her knowledge, the high demand for traditional dresses, the business location, and the regular customers who buy from her and resell in difference towns.  The community will also benefit because they will not have to go a long distance to buy their dresses.

With her profits, Ngwele will be able to improve the housing conditions of her family, pay school fees, and expand her business.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest rate, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy clothes, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Ronald, de 56 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación, así como alegre y amable. Vive en compañía de su hijo de 15 años. Habitan en su propia casa cómodamente. La actividad que realiza Ronald es la transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con sus ahorros hace 03 años. Es así que cada mañana, se levanta muy temprano para buscar sus pasajeros por las calles de la ciudad realizando su jornada hasta el medio día, hora en que regresa a descansar, para luego volver a salir por unas horas en las tardes.
Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres.  Comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y por los ingresos económicos ya que tenía muchas necesidades y gastos que no podía solventar. Ahora se siente mas tranquilo y cómodo ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en los trámites de la compra de una furgoneta  de transporte de carga.
texts.en:
Ronald is 56 years old and is a hardworking man with many desires to succeed.  He’s also happy and friendly and lives with his15 year old son.  They live comfortably together in a home of their own. Ronald provides transportation with his moto-taxi, which he bought with his savings three years ago.  Each morning he gets early and goes out to search for passengers in town.  He stays out until noon and then takes a break and goes back out for a few hours in the evening.

He likes this because he can drive in his spare time.  He says that he decided to do this because he needed a trade and income because he had many financial needs and expenses.  Now he feels more relaxed and comfortable because he has a permanent income and more free time.  He is hoping for your cooperation so that he can solidify his plans.  He will use the money from this loan for 1,500 PEN to invest in a van.

loans.use: to buy a van.

loans.name: Maria Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 44 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 5, 7 y 10 años, ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista y también maquillaje y peinados en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de Viacha de la ciudad del Alto este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de algunos materiales que necesita y productos de belleza para brindar un amejor atencion a sus clientas y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  la Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Maria es tener su cadena de  salones de estética.
texts.en: Maria is 44 years old and has three children, ages 5, 7, and 10.  She is a manicurist and also does makeup and hairstyles in a beauty salon in Viacha, Alto.  This will be her first loan within the institution and she will use the money to buy some beauty products she needs to provide better service and increase her capital.  Maria has challenges in her business, such as over coverage of the market.  She will use her benefits to buy supplies and improve her work.  Maria wants to have a chain of salons.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Sra. Fabiana tiene 26 años, casada tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 1 y 3 años se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de mantas de lana de Alpaca para tiene su domicilio en la comunidad de Puerto Perez, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, Fabiana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus  mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en: Fabiana is 26 years old, married and has two children, ages 1 and 3.  She knits alpaca wool blankets and lives in Puerto Perez.  This will be her second loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy alpaca wool in quantity.  She makes many sales and has many orders in the different El Alto markets this time of year.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Khupting Group

texts.en:
This is Khupting group consisting of nine members. These hard-working tribal women came together in 2010 to support one another to find ways and means to supplement the family income by accessing loan. They all live on the outskirts of Senapati district in Manipur state which is in the North Eastern part of India.

Mangneichong is one of the members, profiled here and pictured with raised hand. She is 22 years old and is a mother to a son and a daughter. She has yet to send her children to school. Her husband who is the main earner works as quarry worker and usually cuts wood to sell. Mangneichong's previous activity before accessing the loan was charcoal-making. 

With her first loan in 2009, Mangneichong started her own store selling general items. She really did well with her store business because it was the only store in her village. With the profit she was able to repay her loan and was also in the position to expand her store by increasing her inventory. With the second loan she expanded her store by bringing in more items, according to her customers' demand. With the profit she bought three piglets to rear. By the end of the year, from the sale of the grown pigs, she bought two He-Buffaloes to help her husband in his transportation of wood to sell. She is very happy that she is becoming a decision-maker for the family. 
 
Now Mangneichong needs another loan for her business. She wishes to increase her stock of general items. She also means to use part of the loan to purchase three more piglets to rear for profit. She plans to enroll her children in a private school next year. She is very happy that now she can support her children's education.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too are making steady improvement with their respective undertakings. Poultry farming, piggeries, a charcoal business, raising cows, and a ginger plantation are some of the income-generating activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store and buy three piglets to rear for profit with part of the loan

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.fr: Généviege est une femme de 42 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 03 et 23 ans . Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des sacs de macabo pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Génévieve is a 42 year old woman, married and mother to 6 children whose ages range from 3 to 23 years old. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh foods (macabos, maniocs, plantains, palm nuts and fruits) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her clientèle which she gained with time thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock to be able to buy again. This is because of her small capital. She would like to buy bunches of plantains and bags of macabo to have a good stock. This will allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets of macabo and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 26-year-old lady, who lives in Margibi County with her two children. The children are 3 and 10 years old, and they are in school. Getrude is a high school graduate, and has been involved with business for the past ten years. She was helped by her mother and, as of today’s date, she has started operating a small, mini provision shop. The shop is her source of income for her living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like rice, oil, candy and biscuits, to resell in her shop.

She hopes to build a new home for her children, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like rice, oil, candy and biscuits, to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel earns a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store. She has been in the business for more than three years.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to offer for sale in her store, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soda. She hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her convenience store, like canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soda.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children, two of them below the age of 15. The family lives in a three-room apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division, North West region of Cameroon. She has encountered many challenges in life, including the death of her brother which forced her to stop school at a tender age, illness of her children, too little money to provide square meals to her children and to provide education for her children.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase foodstuffs, like beans, rice, oil, Irish potatoes and yellow yams, and she will pay for the transportation of these foodstuffs from the bush market to her place of business. She believes that her business will succeed, because of her longevity in the business, the high demand for foods such as beans and yams in the community, her good business location, and the regular customers who buy foods from her for resale and for restaurant use. The community will benefit, because they will not have to go a long distance to buy foodstuffs.

The profits will help her to improve the housing conditions of her family, to provide better education for the children, and to expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE, because of the convenient repayment period, the low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy foods like beans, rice, oil, Irish potatoes and yellow yams, and to transport these things from the bush market to her place of business.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David tiene 29 años sigue con la misma actividad de la tienda de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad  , cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes por mayor, panetones, vino y Cidra para esta época de fin de año.
texts.en: David is 29 years old and has a neighborhood store where he sells primary needs products.  He says that things went well with the previous loan and this time he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as groceries in quantity, breads, wine, and cider for the year end season.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 52 años,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de palomitas de maíz o también conocidas como pipocas que se encuentran en diferentes zonas, ya que las embolsa en distintos tamaños y reparte a colegios, universidades, regimientos militares y tiendas de barrio, este préstamo es el segundo que ha tomado con la institución, Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como maíz por quintales para la elaboración de palomitas de maíz, también hará maní confitado y comprar mani  por mayor, Maria va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando quintales de maíz y también comprara 2 quintales de maní y 2 quintales de azúcar para incursionar en la venta de maní confitado su deseo es el poder  comprar un terreno para sus hijos ya que por ahora vive en la casa de su mama.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old and makes and sells popcorn, also known as pipocas in some zones.  She bags it up in different size bags and passes them out to schools, universities, military regiments, and neighborhood stores.  This will be her second loan through the institution and Maria will use the money to buy supplies like corn by the bushel to make popcorn and also make candied peanuts in quantity.  Maria will also use the benefits to continue buying bushels of corn and two of peanuts and sugar to venture into selling candied peanuts.  She wants to buy land for her children.  They currently live wither mother.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Munawer

texts.en:
Ms Munawer is 55 years old. She has been in the business of milk sales for 11 years. She started her own business to support her family by buying a buffalo when her husband was the only bread winner. With the passage of time her sales and income have both increased. Now she has five buffaloes and cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

She is a mother of five. Three of them go to school. Because of her work she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This wilk help her to be able to cater to more customers in her vicinity which will ultimately improve her earnings. She expects a boost in her business income and she hopes to expand her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 26 years old. She owns a boutique selling foodstuffs. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar, and shoes for sale. The profits from the business will used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en: Megi is from Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 47 years old and lives with her 27-year-old son. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, Megi has a pig and sells piglets seasonally. Megi works hard to do her best for her family. Megi wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Megi and her son suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Foday B's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Affia, a village near Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 4,300,000 Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be empowered to meet their immediate financial challenges. And, at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Salifu is the leader of this group. The 41 year old is a native of Affia village. He is married and has four children attending school. Salifu has served in the teaching profession for 12 years now. However, he is pursuing further studies.  He has therefore requested for this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is a 49-year-old widow with four children who lives in Margibi County. Her children are between the ages of 22 and 30 and are living on their own. Watta has been running a table market for 16 years and she hopes to make it into a shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice palm oil, pepper, and other items for the business. She hopes for her living condition to improve in the near future and to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice palm oil, pepper, and other items for her business,

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn, 37 years old, lives in Aragyux village of Kotayk region with his parents and two children. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. At school, he was one of the best pupils and had a dream of studying at university. But, unfortunately, his parents didn't have enough income to pay for his education. Now, Vahagn works at a local company doing legal work. Last year, he entered Yerevan State University, where he specializes in the judicial field. 
Raising two little kids alone is very difficult for Vahagn, so he has applied for the loan. With the loan's help, Vahagn will pay his university tuition. 
Vahagn wishes to complete his education, start his own business and ensure a better future for his beloved kids.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Namen

texts.en:
Namen is a single mother with four children, three younger than 15. The family lives in a four-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. 
She has faced some challenges in life such as sickness, the death of a family member and inadequate capital to improve her business, which is the greatest problems she is currently facing.
With this loan, she plans to improve her farming and improve the present situation of her business. She plans to buy grand nuts, cocoyams, plantains and bananas. She will also buy beans, garri and seedlings for her farm.  Most of the items will be bought in bulk to allow her to benefit from discounts. She believes her business will succeed because of her longevity and the high demand for her commodities in her community. The community will benefit in that people will not have to travel long distances to buy food items. 
The profit will help her improve the situation of her family, providing better education and meeting health care needs, and also help her to expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, garri, dry corn, ground nuts, plantains and other commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une femme de 44 ans mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, patates, macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des cajots de tomate pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Marguerite is 44 years old and the mother of a family. She is a merchant and has sold various food items (tomatoes, potatoes, cocoyams, manioc, plantains, palm nuts, and fruit) at retail on a seasonal basis at a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of the suppliers and especially her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in this business. However, she constantly faces stock shortages because she needs to sell her entire stock in order to buy new supplies, due to the small amount of capital she has. With this loan, she hopes to buy bunches of plantains and bags of tomatoes to build a larger stock, which will allow her to better satisfy her customers' constant needs and avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plantains and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maqsoodah

texts.en:
Ms Maqsoodah is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children, all of whom go to school.

She has been selling used clothes for eight years. Her husband also assists her in selling the clothes to customers and the local market. She earns enough from this business to lead a decent life. 

Ms Maqsoodah has been involved with Kashf for three years and has gradually improved her business with its support. She has applied for a 15,000 Pakistanti rupee loan in order to purchase winter clothes such as sweaters, pants and coats to sell. 

With this loan she will be able to cater to her customers' needs better, which will ultimately help in generating more income. 

She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes such as sweaters, pants and coats for resale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda earns a living through selling cassava chips which she buys from a farm. Cassava is valued in the Philippines for culinary purposes and is also used to make flour.

Merlinda has been in this business for more than six years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more cassava chips. 

In the future, Merlinda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more cassava chips to sell.

loans.name: Tugwizumwimbu Group

texts.fr:
Aline  fait partie du groupe  Turwizumwimbu et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 25 ans et est marié à  J. Marie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants dont 3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de viande de vache  depuis 6 ans.
