Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  quelques vaches de plus; toutes ces vaches seront abattues pour vendre  une grande quantité de viande,  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    acheter  une grande propriété foncière afin d’entreprendre un vaste projet agro-pastoral.
texts.en:
Aline is a part of the Turwizumwimbu group and lives in Gitega. She is 25 years old and married to a man named J. Marie, a merchant. Together, they have four children, of whom three go to school. 

Aline has been selling beef for six years. She is on her 11th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy some more cows. These cows will be slaughtered and their meat will be sold, allowing her to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a large piece of land in order to commence a large agro-pastoral project.

loans.use: to buy some cows

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru: Арзыкан 48 лет, разведена. Образование высшее.К жизни относиться оптимистично, верит в себя и в светлое будущее своей семьи. Арзыкан очень добрая, общительная, умная и шустрая. Арзыкан  начала свой бизнес 12 лет назад начальная сумма вклада составляла 100,000 KGS. Сегодня Товарооборот Арзыкан  составляет 150,000 KGS. На местном рынке Арзыкан  занимается реализацией одежды и шторы.  В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота за счет покупки зимнего ассортимента утепленных вещей. На доход полученный от кредита она планирует расширять бизнес, и будущем мечтает бостроить двух этажный магазин.
texts.en:
Arzykan is 48 years old, divorced, and she has a higher education degree.  She also has an optimistic outlook on life: she believes in herself and in a bright future for her family.  Moreover, she is very kind, sociable, intelligent and sharp.  

Arzykan started her own business 12 years ago with an initial investment of 100,000 som (KGS).  Her working capital now consists of 150,000 som (KGS).  

Arzykan sells clothes and curtains at the local market.  In order to further expand her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to increase her inventory and buy an assortment of warm winter goods. 

She plans to use the earnings from this loan to expand her business.  In the future, she is dreaming of opening a two-story shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy an assortment of warm winter goods.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is from the village of Tsutskhvati. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife and retired farther. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with a calf and three milk cows. The milk is used in cheese products. He sells the dairy from his house. Grigol also owns four sheep and a pig. In addition, the family grows nuts on the family-owned land. They do all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested nuts are sold at the local open market. He works hard to earn some savings and improve the living conditions for his family. 

Grigol requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 47-years-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, business for several years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Milagros is asking for a loan to buy more inventory to sell in her store like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With a loan, she will be able to improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her store like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from Tkibuli district. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife, retired farther and 7-year-old daughter who goes to the local school. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with one milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. He sells the dairy products at the local open market. 

In addition, the family grows maize on the family-owned land. They do all the relevant agricultural works to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested maize is sold locally. He works hard to earn some savings and improve the living conditions for his family. 

George requested a loan for purchasing an additional milking cow. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Fanalie

texts.en:
This is Fanalie, 44, a resident of Silang, Philippines. She is married to Roy, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Fanalie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fanalie hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Khayriddin

texts.ru: Хайриддин житель района Восеъ. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Хайриддина домохозяйка. Его дети маленькие. Он работает на рынке. У Хайриидина имеется торговая точка, где он продает женскую одежду. Также он продает женскую обувь. Торговлей Хайриддин занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки тканей и детской одежды.
texts.en:
Khayriddin is a 32-year-old resident of the Vose region. He is married and has three small children. His wife is a homemaker. 

Khayriddin works at the market. He has his own stall, where he sells women's clothing and women's shoes. He has been working in sales for five years. He is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and children's clothing

loans.name: Uriat

texts.ru: Урият 53 года, вдова, мать 4 сын. По характеру человек очень хороший и спокойный.  Урият в качестве основного дохода с 1980 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Урият в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Также, Урият обрабатывает 1,2 га земли с эспарцетом и ячменем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урият обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Урият планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и на следующий год отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Uriat is a 53-year-old widow and mother of four sons. She is a good, quiet person. 

As her family's main income provider, Uriate has been working in animal husbandry since 1980. She started her business with 3,000 som. Thanks to persistent work, today she has two dairy cows and ten sheep on her farm. Additionally, Uriat cultivates 1.2 hectares of land with sainfoin and barley. 

With long-term business development in mind, Uriat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som to purchase lambs to feed and later resell. She plans to use the income from the loan to eventually increase the number of livestock on her farm and to renovate her home next year.

loans.use: To purcahse some lambs

loans.name: Natela

texts.ru: Натэла жительница города Душанбе. Она 28 - летняя девушка. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Натэла имеет высшее образование, она экономист. По профессии она не работала. Натэла пять лет проработала в салоне красоты, парикмахером. После того как вышла замуж она занялась воспитанием детей. На сегодняшний день Натэла хочет начать свое дело. Она берет кредит для приобретения мебели и оборудования, чтобы открыть собственный салон красоты.
texts.en:
Natela lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is a 28-year-old married woman and mother of two. 

She has a college education in economics, but she has not worked in this field. She worked as a hairdresser for five years in a beauty salon. Then, after she got married, she stayed at home to raise her children. Now Natela would like to start her own business. She is requesting this loan to purchase furniture and equipment to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and equipment to open her own beauty salon

loans.name: Enver

texts.ru:
Энвер житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 62 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его сын и дочь работают в собственном продуктовом магазине. Жена Энвера домохозяйка. 
Энвер намерен заняться животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа двух бычков и корма для крупнорогатого скота, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Enver lives in the J. Rumy region. He is a 62-year-old married man with two children. His son and daughter work in their own grocery store. His wife is a homemaker. 

Enver intends to start working in animal husbandry. He is requesting this loan to purchase two steer and cattle feed in order to start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase two steer and feed for cattle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 38 year old married woman and mother four young children from Ubay, Bohol.  She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years.  That is the source of their income. 
Elena is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.  Through this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Elena hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading and frozen food businesses. Elsa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arcenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Arcenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Arcenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kenjekkul

texts.ru: Кенжекул 31 года, замужем, у них с мужем 3 детей. Кенжекул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с замужества. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжекул и ее семьи, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец, 2 головы лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Кенжекул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и построить большие сараи для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Kenjekkul is a 31-year-old married mother of three. As the main income provider for her family, she has been working in animal husbandry for eight years. She started her business when she got married. Thanks to persistent work, Kenjekkul and her family now have four cows, 20 sheep, and two horses on their farm. 

With long-term business development in mind, Kenjekkul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som loan to purchase more cattle. She will use the income from this loan to invest in long-term business development and to build large barns where they can keep their cattle.

loans.use: To purchase calfs

loans.name: Yarpu

texts.en: Yarpu is 49 years old and lives in Margibi County, a noted rubber producing area in Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 13 to 16; all of them attend school. For the past two years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells soft drinks. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a bakery business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kosar’s husband. They offer various items such as biscuits, cakes, rusks and bread. They have become famous in their community for providing good quality baked goods. 

Kosar is a mother of five children; two of them are going to school. She is working hard to provide them with the all necessities of life which they deserve. In order to purchase oil, sugar, flour and baking powder from the market at lower rates, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25000 PKR. With this loan, they will be better able to meet customers’ demand time after time. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the prosperous and bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, flour and baking powder from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Argina

texts.en:
Argina lives in Kapan with her husband and two sons. Her elder sun Vache studies history at Goris State University. Vache is in his 2nd year of study. 

Argina works as a nurse at local clinic, and her husband works at a bakery. Their monthly income covers only the family's basic costs and doesn't allow them to pay for their son's education. Therefore, Argina has requested this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan will help Argina's son to complete his education and become a specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor has been earning a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business for several years now. She sells various items to people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. Miraflor needs a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, seasoning and cooking ingredients. In the future, Miraflor wants to make her business a success and save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, seasoning and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is from the village of Rokhi. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband, retired mother and two sons. Lena’s husband works as an artisan locally and gets a small monthly income. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. She sells the dairy products from her house. Additionally, Lena owns a pig and sells piglets seasonally. She works hard to make some savings and improve her family's living conditions. Lena requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese, allowing her to expand her business and earn a good profit. With these increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, spend more on the family’s daily needs, and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Rama Ii Group

texts.fr:
Suavis fait partie du groupe  Rama II et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 24 ans et est mariée à  Rémy, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  2  jeunes enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de savons, des piles, de lait de beauté,  des cahiers, depuis  4ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  savons, de piles, de lait de beauté, de cahiers, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une  très belle maison.
texts.en:
Suavis is a member of the group "Rama II" and lives in Gitega. She is 24 years old and married to Rémy, a merchant. The couple have 2 children together.

Suavis has been selling soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for 4 years. This is her 4th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the years ahead, she would like to build a beautiful house.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of soap, batteries, beauty milk and notebooks for resale.

loans.name: Sasagara Ii Group

texts.fr:
Rosette  fait partie du groupe  Sasagara II  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 69 ans et est mariée à  Elie, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de  restaurant depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de produits vivriers (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) à vendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    acheter  une parcelle et des champs cultivables.
texts.en:
Rosette is a member of the "Sasagara II" group and lives in Gitega. She is 69 years old and married to Elie, a farmer. The couple have 2 children together.

Rosette has run a restaurant for 10 years. This is her 10th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of food (beans, rice, palm oil, etc.) to cook and sell in her restaurant, so that she can earn more money. In the years ahead, she would like to buy a plot of land and some cultivable fields.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of food (beans, rice, palm oil, etc.) to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en: Yatta is 31 years old and lives in Margibi County. She is married and stopped her education at only grade two. She has two children, ages 13 and 14, that are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Gurpu

texts.en:
Gurpu, 48, resides with  her husband in the Congo Town community. She is a hardworking mother of five children who are between the ages of 22 and 33. All of her children live outside the home and are independent. For the past four years, she has been selling coal in her community. She sells for eleven hours a day and makes a profit when she sells. She uses some of the profits to buy more goods to improve her business. Gurpu started this business with a little capital that she had been saving with a saving club.She transports her goods by a commercial vehicle to her business area. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. Her dream is to become a business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Ms. Zaib is a 42-year-old married woman. Two year ago, her husband died a natural death. After her husband's death, she was worried about her family, as her husband was the single breadearner, but she didn't lose hope and started a small general store in the corner of her house to support her children. By this time, she has become famous in her community.

Ms. Zaib offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She wants to grow her business and has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to buy packs of biscuits, beverages, and a stock of sugar from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, beverages, and a stock of sugar from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: 25-year-old Gevorg lives in Yerevan with his mother. He is a very intelligent and proactive young man. He is proudly pursuing his university degree at Armenian State Economical University, where he specializes in the field of statistics. Together with his studies, Gevorg also works at the Ministry of Emergency Situations. Because he helps his mother with household costs, it is difficult to save money for his education. With this loan, he will pay for  his university tuition. This will enable him to complete his education and ensure a better future for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri radica en la comunidad de san Agustín, es una persona cuyo liderazgo le han valido para sobresalir entre su familia de forma acelerada. Tiene dos hijos Roy de 14 años y Miky de 11, pero no viven con él. Es poseedor de una vivienda construida a base de madera. Al cumplir un buen tiempo como agricultor de cacao orgánico decidió optar por un camino más comercial y dinámico desempeñándose como acopiador de productos agrícolas en su comunidad.
Lleva desempeñando su trabajo desde hace 3 años, tiempo que ha logrado hacerse muy conocido por los productores de su zona a quienes adquiere diversos productos como cacao, café, achiote, palillo y barbasco para almacenarlos en un almacén habilitado en su domicilio.
Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que es menos forzoso mas no algo sencillo, puesto que debe contactar con acopiadores mayores de la ciudad para obtener precios justos  para los productos que comercializa beneficiando así tanbien a los productores de su localidad. Desea contar con capital de respaldo para llevar adelante su actividad logrando así recuperar su inversión en corto plazo y con ganancias adicionales.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan la compra de un terreno en la ciudad puesto que sus hijos están a puertas de culminar sus estudios secundarios y como buen padre desea brindarles una educación superior justa , que mejor que lo hagan a futuro en una casa propia para el cual se encuentra trabajando muy duro. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles proseguirá con las actividades de su negocio con la compra de los productos agrícolas de su localidad para luego vendérselo a los acopiadores mayores de las grandes ciudades.
texts.en:
Yuri lives in the community of San Agustín and is a person whose leadership makes him really stand out from his family.  He has two children, Roy (14 years old) and Miky (11) but they do not live with him.  Yuri owns a home built out of wood.  After working some time growing organic cocoa, he decided to head down a more dynamic and commercial path and became a middle man, selling agricultural products from his community.

He has now been doing this for three years and has made himself well-known to the producers in the area.  He now buys various products from these local producers, such as cocoa, coffee, annatto, turmeric and barbasco, which he stores in a space in his home.

He says that he really enjoys his work because he does not feel forced into and it is modest work.  He must contact the bigger wholesalers from the city so that he can sell the products for a fair price, so that the products he is selling are profitable for the producers.  He would like some financial backing so that he can move his business forward, earn back his investment in the short-term, and make a profit.

In the long-term, his aim is to buy land in the city because his children will soon finish high school and, like any good father, he would like to support them with a good further education and their own home.  Yuri is working very hard for this.

With 3000 Nuevo Soles, he will persist with his business by buying agricultural products in his own town, so that he can sell them to bigger wholesalers in the big cities.

loans.use: to buy bags of cocoa, coffee, annatto, turmeric and barbasco to sell to wholesalers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of eight children.

Nida has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now with her husband.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Nida aims to expand her business to augment their income. Additionally, she wants to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a food vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells home-cooked food to the people in her place. She has been in the business for several years now. Pacita is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and rice. With this, she will be able to cook more to sell. In the future, Pacita wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who is determined to change his future and that of his children through hard work. He operates a retail shop and is also a farmer, mainly growing cocoa due to its high demand in the region and low cost of production. Like most responsible fathers, he desires to educate his children up to university. He also wants to venture into sustainable income generating activities with the aim of securing a future for his family. Joseph intends to use this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Unite Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Nyota est une femme dynamique du groupe unité. Elle est mere d’une famille de 9 enfants tous scolarisés à l’âge de 46ans. Elle est vendeuse des boisons sucrées depuis la mort de son mari (5ans) au  marché central de la ville. Le credit  sollicité sera affecté dans le même commerce  en s’approvisionnant en  11 caisses de boissons sucrées.  Son rêve est que ses activités croissent jusqu'à avoir un dépôt(vente en gros). Elle remercie Hekima pour ces prêts.
texts.en: Nyota, the customer, is a dynamic woman and a member of the group "Unité". She is 46 years old and the mother of 9 children who all attend school. She has been selling soft drinks at the town's central market since her husband died, 5 years ago. The loan being requested will be spent on this business and used to buy 11 cases of soft drinks. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can eventually buy a warehouse and sell wholesale. She thanks Hekima for these loans.

loans.use: to buy 11 cases of soft drinks.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married with six children. All are older than fifteen years old. Comfort lives with her six children in a ten-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West region of Cameroon. Comfort encountered some challenges in her lifetime: sickness, the death of her daughter, the death of her grandchild, and the death of her parents. 

With the loan, Comfort plans to buy  two bags of corn,  one bag of garri, buckets of kumkum (dried, graded cassava), a bag of onions,  two cartons of fish, tomatoes, magi, and salt for retail. She believes this activity will succeed because of her longevity in this activity and also she has so many customers. Her business site is located in a strategic place where many people pass by.  The high demand for her commodities in the community is a reason for the success of the activity. The community will benefit in that many people prefer to buy directly from the farm at cheaper prices. 

With the profit, she plans to provide better education, health care for the family and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn,  one bag of garri, buckets of kumkum (dried graded cassava), a bag of onions, cartons of fish, tomatoes, magi, and salt.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.en:
Honorine is married with two children below the age of 15. The family lives in a five-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region, Cameroon. 

Honorine has faced some difficulties in life. A member of her family died after spending some time in the hospital and one of her children has been ill. She has had problems with feeding her children well and catering for their education. She has also had problems finding adequate capital to start up a business.

With the loan she has requested, Honorine will expand her business by buying more items to sell such as soap, laundry products, stocks and sauces and fruit drinks. 

Part of the loan will be used for transporting products from the market to her business site. 

Honorine believes her business will succeed because of her years of experience and the high demand for her products. She has a good business site and has regular customers who buy from her. 

Her community will benefit because they will not need to travel long distances to buy fruit drinks.

With the profits from her loan, Honorine will expand her business, help improve her family's housing conditions, and provide for her family's health and education. She prefers to use a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education provided at their meetings.

loans.use: to buy and transport general grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Jowani

texts.en: Jowani used his previous loan to buy drugs to sell. He is a 29-year-old married man with a child living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a drug shop which he has operated for 3 years, and business is booming since he enjoys a monopoly in his market. Among his hardships are customers who don't pay on time and high fuel and transportation costs. Educating his child and building a permanent residential home for his family are his personal goals, while he dreams of expanding his business into new markets and owning a pharmacy. Jowani intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 57-year-old married man with one child living in Masindi, Uganda. Fifteen years ago, he decided to start a retail shop, and his business has grown over time so that he now boasts of a supermarket. Like most traders, he is faced with the challenge of price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is to open branches in other towns.

Good father that he is, he has so far educated his child, who has now graduated with a degree. He also has other dependents whose fees he pays. Most of them are orphans. Tom is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as bread, tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bread, tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu, 49, lives in the Congo Town community with her husband. She is a mother of five children, aged between 22 and 38. Four of the children live with her at home but are not in school because she lacks financial support. Fatu stopped her own education in the 4th grade. She has had a table in the market where she has been selling peppers, onions, vita, salt, palm oil, rice and cooking oil for the past seven years. She sells from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She is proud of her business because she makes profit, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business and attend the expenses of the home. She has requested this loan to purchase more peppers,onions, vita, rice, and palm oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, onions, vita, rice, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a tailor and has been in service ever since he left vocational school ten years ago. His skills in tailoring can not go unnoticed due to his emphasis on details while making clothes. Thus, he has a large customer base, mainly schools and hotels who order for uniforms in large quantities. However, inadequate capital to buy modern sewing machines hinders his business.

His dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees at university. Moses intends to use this loan to buy materials for making uniforms.

loans.use: to buy materials for making uniforms.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula is taking out another loan to start a new business. She wants to open a grocery store in her home. Thanks to her efforts and the previous loan, she was helped to have a good harvest. Nyamvula intends to use this loan to buy stock of flour, cooking oil, rice, beans and medicines. At the same time, she intends to purchase more planting materials for her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, cooking oil, rice, beans, medicines and planting materials.

loans.name: Mado

texts.en: Mado, 30, has six children between the ages of 2 and 6. All but the two youngest of Mado’s children attend school. She sells potatoes, bananas and many other items. She has been doing this business for three years. She plans to use the profits that she will obtain from the business to buy a plot of land. Mado is celebrating Christmas with her children for the festive season.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Zozan

texts.en:
Zozan, who is 58 years old, lives in Arevadasht village with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. With 300 lambs and 21 cows, the entire family is involved in cattle breeding. Zozan uses the milk in cheese production and provides beef to local butchers. Both milk and beef are very popular among the buyers, thereby making the business profitable. But as the family is big, there are many costs to cover.

Zozan would like to expand her enterprise and increase the number of livestock through the purchase of five heifers and forage for feeding them. This will significantly increase her family's income and enable Zozan to secure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for five heifers and forage to feed them.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old. She is married with three children between 5 and 16. All her children attend schools. Her husband is also a businessman. 

Francine sells shoes. She has been doing this business for 15 years. With the loan, Francine will add more shoes for sale to make more profits. She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for buying a house. She looks forward to celebrating the Christmas season with her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, soap, salt and cups to sell. She is a 28-year-old woman with four children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After selling off her cocoa, she started a retail business with the profits she earned. 

She is challenged by price fluctuations and customers not paying on time. Her dreams are educating her children to the university level and moving her business to a more permanent location.

Ester intends to use the loan to buy maize flour, cassava and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassava and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is 28 years old, stopped her education in the seventh grade. She lives with her husband in the Congo Town community. He is a businessman. She is a hardworking mother of three children between the ages of 9 and 15. Only one of the children stays with her at home and is attending school. 

Rose has a table where she sells artificial hair and also braids hair. She sells from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She learned this type of trade from a Nigerian woman for whom she has worked. She is grateful to the lenders for their support in her business. She makes a profit when she sells because she sells quality artificial hair.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her retail business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her retail business.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 39 years old. She sells shoes and has been in this business for nine years. She wants a loan to buy more shoes for sale with the intention of making more profits. 

Alphonsine plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for building a home. She has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 28-year-old, hardworking man who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Four years ago, he decided to trade in goats after assessing the lucrative nature of the business. This is due to the fact that goats are used as a dowry during customary marriages in the district and other traders export them to the Democratic Republic of Congo.

His major challenge is inadequate capital to supply the vast market while his dreams are to own a ranch and also trade in cattle. William intends to use the loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with two children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has applied for a loan of 1200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.  She has been in this business for one year, working seven days a week and selling to all categories of people on a retail basis in the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used shoes bales. She aspires to become a wholesaler of used shoes and also to start importing them. She resides in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used  shoes.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 20 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a small shop which is an internet cafe and games centre for children since 2010. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy play station devices for his internet cafe. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his customers and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy play station devices for his internet cafe

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-one-year-old single mother of  three children living in Kasese,Uganda.She has been in the retail business for five years and also sells clothes, which is where we found her at the time of this interview. Margret started her business to earn extra income to support her family.Like most traders, she faces the challenges of stiff competition and price fluctuation; nevertheless she desires to own a super market. Margret intends to use the loan to buy sugar, rice and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is 30 years old and has two children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the transportation business for seven years and with his earnings he has been able to pay school fees for his children and provide them with the basic necessities. He also trades in produce to supplement his transport business.

Siraji is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy maize to sell.  Accidents and mechanical breakdowns due to poor roads pose a challenge to his business while his dream is to own a transport company.

loans.use: to purchase maize to sell.

loans.name: Kagugu Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en: Birizitta, aged 67, is a widow and the oldest member of the group. She has six children and 3 dependants. She was encouraged to join the group after failing to raise the tuition fees for her two children in secondary school, who did not get their report cards because of the incomplete payment.She will use her income from plantain sales to pay back this loan. She is grateful that Ugafode has provided a solution for her most urgent need when no one else was willing to help her. Her major challenge is having limited capital in her plantain business. She also has many dependants, who end up encroaching on all her capital, yet she has no husband to give her a hand. She is hard working and persevering. Birizita is the third on the right with a yellow t-shirt while the sixth person in the photo, who is the first from the right in a tie is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 33 years old. She sells shoes. She wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from her business will be used for renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese,Uganda.Ten years ago he decided to venture into the clothing business in order to support his family since his salary was so low and unreliable. Price fluctuations and ever changing customer preferences are his major challenges. He dreams to own a modern boutique. Like most good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the university level. Patrick  intends to use the loan to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy  clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is 43 years old. She has three children, aged between 14 and 17, all of whom attend school. Placidie sells different types of shoes. She has been doing this business for twelve years. She plans to use the profits obtained from her business to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia con tan solo 20 años es una joven soltera y con muchos deseos de superación, vive al lado de su madre en una vivienda que recibió por parte de su padre en calidad de herencia. Desde hace 3 años motivada por seguir al lado de su familia y por aportar al progreso familiar tomó las riendas de las parcelas que su padre labraba y es desde entonces que se dedica íntegramente a la producción de cacao y café en su zona.
Le agrada su trabajo porque considera que es una manera sana y tranquila de ganarse el pan de cada día siempre al lado de su familia.
Para iniciarse en la campaña de siembra de éstos granos, desea contar con capital de trabajo para contratar a jornaleros de la zona quienes la apoyaran en actividades como sacar la maleza, limpiar su parcelas con el objetivo de optimizar su producción, asimismo desea adquirir sacos de abono orgánico consistente en guano de ave que son exactamente lo que sus tierras requieren sus plantas.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, agradecida desde ya por la oportunidad se siente muy confiada y comprometida con el pago de sus cuotas. Es una socia muy activa a pesar de su corta edad, pues ocupa el cargo de secretaria en el grupo siendo muy eficiente su trabajo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles contratará a jornaleros para que le ayuden a sacar la maleza de sus parcelas y la compra de sacos con abono orgánico, como es el guano de ave para una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Katia is 20 years old and is a young single woman with many desires to succeed.  She lives with her mother in a house she inherited from her father.  Three years ago, motivated by staying alongside her family and to help them move ahead, she took charge of the farmland that he father used to work.  Since then she has been raising cacao and coffee in her zone.

She likes her work because she considers it to be safe and relaxing to be able to win her daily bread alongside her family.

In order to begin her planting season for these grains, she would like to be able to count on working capital so that she can hire field hands to help her do things like weed the land and clear her parcels so that she can optimize her production.  She also wants to buy sacks of compost containing bird guano.  This is exactly what her plants need.

This will be her second loan through MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity.  She feels confident and committed to make her payments on time.  She is a very active member and works as the group’s secretary. 

She will use the 1,000 PEN to hire field hands who will help her clean off the land.  She will also buy sacks of compost with guano in order to have quality production.

loans.use: to buy compost and pay for labor.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Odette.  She is married and has one child, 32 years old. Odette has one additional dependent who lives with her. 

In 1987, Odette established her cosmetics and drinks business. She began her business immediately after she completed a certificate course in business studies and could not secure a job. Therefore, she decided to go into business for herself since she already had the idea and experience. 

Odette's business is located at the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working seven days per week and ten hours per day, she earns about 850,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Odette would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Odette requires a loan in order to buy assorted drinks since they are now more in demand. In the future, Odette plans to become a leading supplier of drinks. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks for resale since they are now more in demand.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 31 years old. She owns a bar and has been business for five years. 

She wants the loan to buy more beers and sodas for sale with the intention of making more profits. She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking powder and fire wood to use in baking.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 28 years old. She owns a boutique and has three children. They all go to school. 

With the loan, Olive plans to add more sugar and rice to the business in order to make more profits. The profits from the business will be used to build a house for her residence.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Tutumike Group

texts.fr: Nzigire est une cliente ambitieuse, présidente  de l’association de credit  Tutumike. Mariée à un fonctionnaire de l’Etat est mere de 7enfants tous scolarisés à l’âge de 45 ans. Elle vend devant sa porte dans un bidonville depuis plus de 5ans des habits usagers. Elle sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son commerce par l’achat d’un ballon de friperie.  Son vouloir est que ses affaires prospèrent. Elle remercie grandement Hekima.
texts.en: Nzigire is an ambitious customer and the leader of the loan group Tutumike. Married to a civil servant, she is 45 years old and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. She has been selling second-hand clothing outside her front door in a shanty town for over 5 years. She is requesting this loan so that she can strengthen her business by buying a bale of second-hand clothes. She would like her business to prosper, and is very thankful to Hekima.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ricsi Ascaria

texts.es: La Sra. Ricsi tiene 40 años ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista, pedicurista y también maquillaje y peinados en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona de San Jose de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ricsi va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de cremas para la cara para el cabello pestañas, esmaltes que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  la Sra. Ricsi  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Ricsi es tener un salón de belleza reconocido por las clientes por el buen trabajo que ella realiza.
texts.en:
Ricsi, 40, makes a living doing manicures, pedicures, make up, and hairstyles in her beauty salon in the San José area of the city of Santa Cruz.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  Ricsi's going to use the loan to buy face cream, eyelashes, and nail polishes that she needs.  This way she'll increase her working capital.

Ricsi faces the challenge of getting greater market coverage for her business.  She's going to use the profits to continue buying supplies and improving her work.  Ricsi wants to have a beauty salon known to customers for the good work she does.

loans.use: to buy cream, eyelashes, and nail polish

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de Sabanas y edredones cuneta que con el anterior credito se compro un televisor para su uso personal y en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de sabanas y edredones al por mayor ya que esta epoca es de mucha demanda para estos productos y es tambien ella donde aprovecha ya que genera mas ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is continuing to sell sheets and quilts. She says that with her previous loan, she bought a television for her personal use.

On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy sheets and quilts in bigger quantities as it is the time of year when there is a lot of demand for these products. She will also benefit since it will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sheets and quilts in bigger quantities.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 40 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Leónidas, su esposo desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo cuidan de 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Desde joven su principal sueño, fue tener un restaurante, ahora se siente feliz, pues logró lo que tanto anheló. Todas las mañanas trabaja sin descanso en la preparación de los alimentos para los comensales que llegan desde 7 años, a consumir los ricos platos que solo Liz, cocina. Su especialidad son los alimentos caseros y balanceados con productos de calidad; que ella misma escoge en el mercado, “tienen que ser frescos”, comenta. Su trabajo se centra de lunes a viernes, pues los fines de semana, dedica todo su tiempo, a su esposo e hijos. Su esposo trabaja como asistente en la gobernación de su localidad, donde recibe un sueldo mensual. Ahora ella desea mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante, para que sus clientes se sientan felices y sobre todo cómodos en el momento de la comida. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Liz de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de platos y productos de primera necesidad al por mayor, para la preparación de los platos de comida.
texts.en:
Liz, age 40, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Leónidas, her husband of 22 years.  They have four children, three of whom they still care for in their own home.

Ever since she was young, Liz’s greatest dream has been to have a restaurant.  Today she is happy because she has achieved what she longed for so much.  Every morning she works without a break at preparing the food for her guests, who have been coming to her restaurant for seven years for the delicious dishes that only Liz cooks.  Her specialty is homemade and balanced dishes made with high-quality products that she herself selects in the market –“they have to be fresh” she says.  She works Mondays to Fridays, because she devotes all of her time on the weekends to her husband and children.  Her husband works as an assistant in their town government, where he receives a monthly salary.  Liz would now like to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant so that her customers are happy, and above all, comfortable, while eating.

This is Liz’s fifth loan with MFP.  She feels happy because she has the necessary capital to improve her business and therefore her quality of life.  Moreover, she likes belonging to her association because its members are supportive and hardworking.  Upon receiving its support, Liz will invest the requested money in the purchase of basic food products and ingredients at wholesale prices, which she will use to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy basic food products and ingredients at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 34, is single and has three children between the ages of 6 and 18. They are currently in school. Alice lives in the Congo Town community. 

She has been selling ladies' blouses and ladies' skirts for the past four years. She loves to do this business because she makes a profit, and with the profit she attends to the needs of her children.

She works 12 hours a day and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. One of the difficulties she faces is low sales during the raining season. 

She appreciates the lenders for their support of her business, because with the business she feels self-reliant. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has one child, age 12 years. She has three additional dependents that live with her to assist them for their schooling.   

In 1996, Fatmata established her textiles business. She began her business just after her mother died and she took over the business. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are women. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy a half bail of cotton. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit by Le 700,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to rent a shop that can accommodate a large quantity of goods as she now experiences large numbers of customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a half bail of cotton.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 28 years old and lives in Gaza. He is married and has five children.

He owns a shop in which he sells electrical appliances.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more goods, lights, and bulbs for the shop.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more goods, lights, and bulbs for the shop.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is 23 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife and child.

He owns a place for bricks manufacturing.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a blocks crusher, which will help him increase the productivity of the business.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a blocks crusher.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of drinks and buy her license.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik lives in the Nor Kesaria village of the Armavir region with her husband and two children. 

Goharik is involved in farming. She has a plot of land where several kinds of vegetables are grown. Her husband, Edvard, is an electrician and works at a local company. He gets a monthly income but it is not enough to cover the family's everyday expenses. So, together with her husband, Goharik decided to start raising cattle. 

She has requested a loan to purchase a cow, three oxen and forage for feeding them. The loan will help Goharik and her husband to accomplish their goals and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, three oxen and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
She is married and has four children, all of them below the age of 15. They live in a five-room apartment in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
She has faced some difficulties in life including the death of one of her family members after spending some time in the hospital for medication. Other problems she has encountered include the illness of her child, inadequate capital to start up a business, inability to provide good meals for her children and to support her children's education.

With the loan requested, she will expand her business size by buying more cloth and ready-made dresses. She also plans to buy oil in bulk and sell it in town. Part of the loan will be used for the movement of the products from the bush market to the business site. 

She believes her business will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for dresses and oil in the market. She has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from her. The community will benefit because they will not go a long distance to buy oil and some of their dresses.

With the profits, she will help improve the housing conditions of the family, provide better education and health for the family and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide at the various meetings.

loans.use: to pay for cloth and ready-made dresses.

loans.name: Clesance

texts.en:
Clesance, 37, sells food in her store and has been in the business for five years. 

She wants the loan to buy more cassava flour, sweet potatoes, beans and rice for sale. 

She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour, sweet potatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 37-year-old, married man with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for six years. He also hires out land to farmers. 

Inadequate capital to meet customer demands and failure of tenants to pay on time hinder his income projections. His dream is to venture into farming. 

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old, married woman with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, she has been selling cassava flour and, with the money earned, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Seasonal weather changes affect Mary's business. Her dream is to own a food store. 

Mary is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Wangang

texts.en:
Wangang is married and the father of seven children, one of which is under 15. He and his family live in a five-room apartment in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon. 

Wangang has encountered some challenges in life, such as sickness and the death of two of his children. Currently, the main problem he faces is inadequate capital to improve his business.

With the requested loan, Wangang plans to buy more piglets to expand his pig farm. He also plans to improve his pig farming by constructing more fences and buying more feeders. He also wants to harvest wood in the forest for resale. 

He believes this activity will succeed because of his longevity in the field and the high demand for his commodities in the community. His community, which is increasing in population, provides a ready market, and they will no longer have to travel long distances to buy pork and good wood.

With the profit from his expanded business, Wangang will improve the situation of his family: he will provide better education and health care for them as well as further expanding his business. 

Wangang prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeders.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 34 years old. She sells women's dresses, which she has been doing for five years. Marie Louise is requesting a loan, which she will use to add more women's clothes to sell. She will use the profits from her business to buy a house for her residence.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en: Bendera is requesting a new loan, which she will use to invest in her tailoring business by buying a sewing machine. She still operates her food stall, which earns her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is 28 and married with one child who goes to school. She sells shoes and has been in the business for two years. She wants the loan to buy more shoes for sale and increase her profits. 

Assia plans to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees. She is very thankful and looking forward to celebrating Christmas with her family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is Hawanatu. She is 34, married, and has three children aged ten, six, and four. In 2001, Hawantu established her textiles business. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are middle-aged people. She began her business because she decided to reduce the burden of her husband, whose monthly salary is not sufficient for the family's needs. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL a month. 

Hawanatu would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan to buy more Africana dresses, which are in increasing demand. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profits. In the future, Hawanatu plans to expand her business to sell clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dresses for sale.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business for three years. He is also a farmer; he primarily grows food crops that he sells to nearby markets. He dreams of sending his children to university and setting up rental houses to secure their future.

Ivan's business plan is to open a wholesale shop despite challenges of inadequate capital. Ivan intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old and married with one child. She sells ladies' shoes and has been in this business for three years. 

Alice would like a loan to buy a greater variety of styles of shoes for sale. She plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 23-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for two years. She works six days a week, and her business attracts many customers because it is located in a busy street. 

Judith faces challenges like price fluctuations and the seasonal nature of her business. Her dream is to own a boutique. Judith intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 41-years-old. He lives in the Qarakert village of the Armavir region with his wife and three children. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. Karen keeps two cows and 40 colonies of bees. He also grows apricot and apple trees. The honey that he gets from the bees is in high demand, but Karen's income isn't enough to meet the family's needs and cover the farm's operational expenses. 

So Karen decided to request this loan to buy five calves. He will raise them and then sell them at a profit. This will significantly increase Karen's income and enable him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 49 years old.  She is married with five children.  Recently, Laurence sells different items such as beans, cooking oil and charcoal and she plans to make this business more profitable.  The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cooking oil and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Elizabeth.  She is single and has five children ages 24, 21, 18, 14, and 11 years.  

In 1987, Elizabeth established her slippers and sandals for ladies business.  She began her business because she wanted to be self reliance and to be economically viable being that she lost her husband and was left with five children.  Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are ladies.  Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  Elizabeth requires a loan in order to buy additional slippers and sandals for ladies.  She hopes that this loan will help increase her monthly profit of SLL 800,000.  In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand her market stall to a more spacious and conducive outlet.  She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy additional slippers and sandals for ladies.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 46 years old from the Senaki District.  She lives with her husband and 3 children. 

The family runs an agricultural business.  In particular, they have a milk cow and 4 buffaloes, whose milk is used in cheese production.  They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price.  Besides this, they have 3 pigs and sell piglets locally.  In addition, they have 2 hectares of agricultural land, where maize is grown. 

Nona is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest.  Nona requested a loan for purchasing building materials.  After purchasing the building materials they will build a shed since the existing shed is too small and is in poor condition.  They will be able to expand the dairy farm and thus sell more dairy products.  They will sell dairy production locally and thus increase their income.  With increased income they will improve the living conditions.  Nona awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a shed

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en:
Ayisha is 28 years old.  She is married and blessed with four children. 

She sells shirts and skirts.  She wants the loan to buy more shirts for sale.  The profits from the business will be meant for savings.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment for service reserve equipment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old, married and has one child.  She owns a shop and has been in business for the past four years.  She also earns income by selling chickens and eggs.  

Faulu Kenya has helped her expand her shop.  She hopes to open up a supermarket in the future. She requires a loan of 84,442 KES to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, soda and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, soda and cooking fat

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 46 years old.  She sells ground peanuts.  She is a widow with four children and they all go to school. 

With the loan, she plans to add more ground peanuts to make more profits.  The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more ground peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Gatama

texts.en:
Gatama is 38 years old. He owns a boutique and has spent 10 years in the business. He also works as a cobbler and has spent a couple of years in this business. 

Gatama is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy more shoes and shoe polishes that can help him run his business easily with all the needed products. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business. He is very happy with the previous loan, which helped him purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and shoe polishes.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is a businessman who owns a shop and he has been in business for three years. He is also employed and is very hard working, self disciplined, and focused. 

Anderson has employed two people to help him with the business. Someday, he hopes to open a supermarket. Anderson needs a loan of 23,955 KES to buy sugar, maize flour, kerosene, cooking fat, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, kerosene, cooking fat, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 30 years old. She sells shoes and has been in that business for the past eight years. With this loan, she wants to add more shoes to her inventory. She will use the profits from the business to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam runs a hardware shop. She requested a loan of 50,000 KES. She used the loan to buy pipes, iron sheets, blockboard and plywood. She made good sales with the additional stock. She used the additional income to pay school fees for her children.

Miriam hopes to expand her business in the future. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 105,300 KES to buy paints, nails and plywood.

loans.use: to buy paints, nails and plywood.

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 51 year old married man.  He lives with his wife and four sons in Rafah city located in Gaza Strip.  Reyad is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.  The family now is in need of some necessary home appliances such as a stove and washing machine. 

Reyad took a loan from FATEN to buy these home appliances.  This loan will help the family to cover part of the necessary expenses.

Reyad appears in the photo.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances for the family

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 33-year-old single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a politician and has been in service for five years. She decided to join politics to fulfill her dream of advocating for the poor and other underprivileged people. 

Because politics is unreliable, Janet wants to start a retail shop. She hopes to send her children to university one day. Janet is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en:
Amaal is 40 years old and married. Her family of seven lives in Nablus and two of her children attend school. She owns a small mobile phone sales and maintenance shop.

Amaal asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more mobile phones and improve the entrance of her shop. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her family's income. The man who appears in the picture with Amaal is her husband, who did not want his wife pictured by herself.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and improve the entrance of her shop.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is Isha. She is 48, married, and has three children aged 34, 20 and 10. In 2006, Isha established her textiles and cosmetics business. Her business is located at the city center. She started the business to have a source of revenue so that she does not have to depend wholly on her husband to provide for their family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month. 

Isha would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more stock for her shop. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her monthly profits. In the future, Isha plans to establish another shop for her nephew. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Iura

texts.en:
Lura is 51 years old from the Khobi District.  He lives with his wife, who works in kindergarten as a teacher and gets a monthly income.  The family runs an agricultural business.  In particular, they have 2 milk cows and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price.  In addition, they have 2 horses and 2 pigs and sell piglets locally.  In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize, nut trees and tangerine-trees are grown. 

Lura is a very hard working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Lura requested a loan for purchasing building materials.  After purchasing building materials they will build a shed, as the existing shed is too small and in poor condition.  They will be able to expand the dairy farm and thus sell more dairy products.  They will sell dairy production locally and thus increase their income.  With increased income they will improve their living condition. Lura awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a shed

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She is a business lady who supplies snacks to various shops.  She has been in business for twelve years and describes her customers as very loyal.  She is very hard working and ambitious. 

Faulu Kenya has helped her develop a saving culture.  She dreams of educating her children up to university levels and to open up a supermarket in the future.  She requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy more sweets, biscuits, crisps, pop corns, peanuts and cakes.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, biscuits, crisps, pop corns, peanuts and cakes

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is a 44-year-old woman from Lanchkhuti district. She lives with her husband, her 23-year-old son, and her brother. Her son works locally as an artisan and gets monthly income. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Locally, they sell cheese in an open market, at a good price. In addition, they have five hectares of agricultural land where maize is grown. 

Naili is a very hard-working woman and has rich experience in her business. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. Naili requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. 

After purchasing the additional milk cow, the family will be able to produce more dairy products and, thus, increase sales and the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Naili awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and produce dairy products for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has three children. She owns a food market, selling different items, which she has been doing for two years.

Sarah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more sugar, beans, rice, and cooking oil to sell. She plans to use the profits to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eufemia Margarita

texts.es:
EUFEMIA MARGARITA.
tiene una venta de variedades y ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, situada a un costado de su casa en la calle principal de su colonia llamada bosques de Vista Hermosa, también vende juguetes en general, trastos de peltre, ropa interior y ganchos . Ella nos cuenta que las ventas están muy bien y el negocio cada día está creciendo en clientes ya que cada vez piden más cosas y algunas, ella tiene y otras no.  Por tal motivo ella se ven en la necesidad de solicitar otro crédito para poder comprar las cosas que le hacen falta y así no quedar mal con sus clientes cuando la llegan a visitar a su tienda.  Ella nos dice que la buena fecha ya viene, y las fiestas de navidad son de aprovechar, nos dice que ya tiene unos encargos de pantalones, chumpas y botas para dama, pero no le alcanza el dinero que tiene ahorrado. Espera seguir contando con su apoyo a través de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Eufemia Margarita has a variety shop with clothes for men, women, and children. It is located on the side of her house on the main street of her neighbourhood called Bosques de Vista Hermosa. She also sells general toys, pewter dishes, undergarments and clothes hangers.
