She reports that sales are going very well and that every day her clientele is growing. Her clients increasingly request more items, some of which she already has, but other she does not. Because of this, she needs to request another loan to be able to buy the required items so as not to disappoint her clients when they visit her store. Christmas is soon arriving, and she thinks she should make the most of the holidays. She tells us that she already has some pants, jackets and women's boots on order, but she doesn't have sufficient money saved to purchase them. She hopes to continue receiving your support through the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a widow with seven children, all over 15. She lives in a four-room apartment with her four children in Bamenda, Cameroon. 

Theresia has encountered challenges in her life like sickness and the death of her husband. These problems drained her funds and left her with inadequate capital to improve on her business. However, she says that by God's grace she is well now.

With the loan, Theresia plans to buy more items for her electrical appliance store. She also plans to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings, such as maize, beans, yams, and groundnuts. 

Theresia believes this activity will succeed because of her longevity in these activities and most especially because of the support of her son, who is acting as a sales person in her electrical appliance store. The high demand for her commodities in the community is a reason for the success of her farming activity, which she does on her own land. The community will benefit in that many people prefer to buy directly from the farm at cheaper prices. 

With the profits from her businesses, Theresia will improve the situation of her family by providing better education and health care for them. She will also further expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to pay for electrical appliances and seedlings like beans, corn, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 20 years old. He is from Gaza and he owns a stall for selling home and kitchen appliances.

Ahmad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy some goods and a tent to cover the upper part of his stall. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy some goods and a tent to cover the upper part of his stall.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, 64, is from the Senaki District. She lives with her husband, son, and parents-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. They also have a pig and a horse. 

Tea is a very hard-working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Tea requested a loan for purchasing building materials for a greenhouse. Building a greenhouse will allow the family to sow tomatoes and cucumbers. They will sell the harvested products locally and thus increase their income and improve their living conditions. Tea thankfully awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is Isata. She is 35, married, and has three children, aged 15, 12, and 8. In 2000, Isata established her rice and local foodstuffs business in the city center. Isata started her business because she wanted to help her husband to take care of the home with her own financial contribution. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. 

Isata would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy 40 bags of rice. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits. In the future, Isata plans to rent a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Abdullatif

texts.en:
Abdullatif, 22, is from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2011.

Abdullatif asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more goods and enlarge the space of his store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more goods and enlarge his store.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 42 years old. He is the father of four children, all of whom go to school. He is a cobbler and also sells shoes. 

Damascene has requested a loan to upgrade his shoe sales business by purchasing more stock and repairing damaged shoes. With the profits from the business he will pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is Musu. She is 41, married, and has one child, aged 22. She has one additional dependent who lives with her and works as a sales assistant. In 2008, Musu established her used carpets and chairs business. She began her business to help her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located at the city center. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. 

Musu would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more carpets and chairs. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her monthly profits. In the future, Musu plans to expand her business so that she can become a leading supplier of used items. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more carpets and chairs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has nine children. She used her previous loan to buy more radios and televisions to sell. Her business did very well, and she repaid her loan successfully. She has been in business for six years and also earns an income from rental houses that she owns. 

Faulu Kenya has helped her learn how to save her money.

She hopes to expand her retail shop in the future. She requires a loan of 105,300 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy second-hand radios and televisions to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand radios and televisions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer, 62, is from the Senaki District. He lives with his wife and cousin. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have eight milk cows and four calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. They also have two pigs and sell piglets. In addition, Vladimer has a plot of land, where nut trees and maize are grown. 

Vladimer is very hard-working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Vladimer requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow to produce more dairy products and thus increase the income and improve the living conditions of the family. Vladimer awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 38 and married to a technician. She sells clothes and has been in this business for one year. 

Francine has requested a loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 36 years old, married and has been blessed with four children who are all in school. He has been in business for four years and also earns an income from farming. He is very hardworking and responsible, as he has to support his family. Through the financial support of Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business tremendously and increased his capital.

He hopes to expand his shop. He wants a loan of 20,857 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is aged 43. She sells women's attire known as “bitenge.” She wants this loan to add more bitenge to sell because ladies from Rwanda do like to wear the fashions of bitenge. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more ladies clothes commonly known as "bitenge" to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres juntamente con sus hermanas mayores ocupando una habitación pero comparte las demás dependencias con su familia, las paredes están revocadas con estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri Sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como diseñador gráfico en una empresa gráfica ya hace un año percibiendo un salario mensual, el colabora con los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere realizar la operación de la nariz por que tiene un problema respiratorio, eso le ayudara a poder estar mejor concentrado en su trabajo y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Roberto  es adquirir su propio negocio gráfico colocando un taller de imprenta y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Roberto’s single and has no children; he lives in his parents’ house with his older sisters.  He has his own bedroom but shares the rest of the house with his family.  The walls are stucco-covered and the floor is wood.  The house is located in the Pasankeri zone in the south part of the city of La Paz.

He currently works as a graphic designer for a design firm.  He’s been employed for a year and earns a monthly salary.  He helps pay for the family’s basic utility costs.

He needs the loan to pay for nose surgery because he has a breathing problem.  This will help him better concentrate at work and be able to improve his income.  Roberto’s dream is to own his own graphic design business and to set up a printing shop to improve his quality of life.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for nose surgery.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler juntamente con sus abuelos ocupando una habitación pero comparte las demás dependencias con sus abuelos, las paredes están revocadas con estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como procurador en un bufet de abogados realizando tramites de legalización ya hace un año percibiendo un salario mensual, el colabora con los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar  los trámites de egreso de su carrera de la facultad de derecho y poder ejercer como abogado y así poder tener un ingreso  mejor.
El sueño de Emanuel es adquirir su propio estudio jurídico y poder manejar sus propios casos y poder tener personas que le colaboren como actualmente  hace en la ciudad de La Paz y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Emanuel’ single and has no children.  He actually rents from his grandparents  occupying his own bedroom but sharing the rest of the space with his grandparents.  The walls are stucco-covered and the floor is wood.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.

He currently works as an attorney in a law office doing legalization transactions.  He’s been employed for a year now and earns a monthly salary.  He helps pay his family’s basic utility costs.  He needs the loan to pay his law school graduation fees so that he can work as an attorney and earn higher income.

Emanuel’s dream is to have his own law office and to be able to handle his own cases and have staff who works for him like he’s doing now in La Paz thus improving his quality of life.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay law school graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks and absolutely essential food products.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркату 46 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена очень добрая женщина и всегда старается помочь мужу в ведении бизнеса. Его дети не совершеннолетние и учатся в школе. Фуркат всегда старается обеспечить своих детей и жену хорошим условием проживания. Более 19 лет он занимается выращиванием зерновых культур. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Furkat is 46 years old, married and has 2 young school-aged children. His wife is a very kind woman who always tries to help him run his business. Furkat has always tried to provide his wife and kids with a good standard of living. For the last 19 years, he has been growing crops and selling his harvest at the market. Because his crops are of very high quality, there is a lot of demand for it. For the purpose of improving his family's living standard and giving them all the necessities, he wants to develop his business. In order to do so, he needs to increase his harvest, so he is seeking a loan of 2,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to give his children a good education and to improve their lives. Furkat needs your support and is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She sells used clothes, which she has been doing for four years. Rose is a very hard working and organized lady. She describes her business environment as being very busy and having loyal customers. 

Rose is requesting a loan for 20,857 KES, which she will use to increase her stock of clothes Through the financial support of Faulu Kenya, she has handled her business properly and increased her profits. In the future, she hopes to open other outlets of her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en alquiler junto con su mamá,  ocupando tres habitaciones incluyendo su cocina y baño, en un acabado de adobe y tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona  San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Alejandro esta estudiando derecho y trabaja como profesor de computación en dos colegios donde percibe un sueldo mínimo con el cual cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, pago de alquiler de la vivienda que habita

El crédito que solicita es para continuar sus estudios y pagar la matricula correspondiente a este semestre, ya que lo que Alejandro quiere es egresar de una vez como abogado y poder mejorar sus ingresos, 

Su sueño es terminar la carrera e instalar un bufet propio 

Es la tercera vez que saca credito con IMRO  y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Alejandro rents with his mother occupying three rooms including kitchen and bath; the house is adobe and dirt and is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  

Alejandro is studying Law and works as a computer programming teacher in two schools earning minimum wage that he uses to cover food, utility and rental costs.  The loan he’s requesting is to continue with his studies and pay tuition costs for next semester because Alejandro wants to finally graduate as a lawyer to be able to improve his income.  His dream is to complete his studies and open his law office.  This is his third IMPRO loan and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay law school tuition fees.

loans.name: Martha Frida

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 44 años, ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos que son de 3 y 25  años,  la Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de Dvds de música  en su tienda de venta que se encuentra en su misma casa que está en la zona de Plan 482,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de albunes de villancicos navideños, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, la  Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha, 44, is a widow and has two children who are 3 and 25 years old.  Martha sells music DVDs in a store located in her house which is in the Plan 482 zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Martha will use it to buy Christmas carol albums because demand for them is high this season.  

The business challenge Martha faces is lack of ready cash to buy these products and she will use profits to continue buying a variety of seasonal products to sell.  Her dream for the business is to grow more and to help her family since this is the activity by means of which she supports her family.

loans.use: to buy music albums, Christmas carols.

loans.name: Susy Ines

texts.es: La Señora Susy  tiene 47 casad tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en la universidad, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas y frazadas en su tienda que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Cotoca,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Señora Susy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de Frazadas y edredones por mayor ya que  esta época de de fin de año tiene mucha demanda y ella desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, La Señora Susy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Susy, 47, is married and has two children attending university.  She sells a variety of comforters, sheets and blankets in her store that’s located in her house in the Cotoca zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Suzy will use it to buy a variety of blankets and comforters at wholesale because demand for them at the end of the year is high and she wants to stock up.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she got orders but did not have enough capital to fill them.  The business challenge Susy faces is competition and high seasonal demand and she will use profits to increase her merchandise and thus her sales.

loans.use: to buy blankets and comforters.

loans.name: Oscar Luis

texts.es: El Joven Oscar  tiene 25 años el se dedica al tapizado de muebles y también de automóviles desde hace tres años, este crédito es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de  cuero y cuerina por rollos estos materiales  le servirán para su trabajo,  El Joven Oscar  está muy contento ya que tiene mucha clientela  y le va muy bien y también por el crédito ya que esta es una opción para crecer en su negocio y por ende generar mayores ingresos El Joven Oscar  es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Young Oscar, 25, has been upholstering furniture and also cars for the last three years.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and he will use it to buy leather and faux leather by the roll; these materials will be useful for his work.  Oscar is very happy because he has a large clientele and he does very well and also because of the loan because this is an option for business growth and thus to generate higher income.  Oscar is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy leather and faux leather in quantity.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La Sra. Sara tiene 32 años y es soltera con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de  3 años, ella se dedica al servicio de  todo tipo de transcripciones en su domicilio que se encuentra en la zona de Tejada Triangular, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sara va a usar este préstamo de  para la compra de computadora e impresora y hojas por su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material, a ella le gusta entregar sus trabajos con puntualidad y esmero ya que dice que los clientes son primero sud deseo para su negocio a la larga es poder brindar un servicio de internet, fotocopiadoras y trascripciones.
texts.en: Sara, 32, is single and has a three-year-old son.  She works at home providing all types of transcription services; her house is located in the Tejada Triangular zone.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Sara will use it to buy a computer, printer and paper for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase capital.  She will us profits to continue buying materials.  She likes to deliver her work on time and well-done because she says that her customers come first and her wish for her business in the long run is to be able to provide Internet access service, photocopies and transcriptions.

loans.use: to buy a computer, printer and paper.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 37 years old. She has been selling fish for eight years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more fish for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy her house of residence.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by selling clothes and describes her business as being very busy. She is very hardworking and has been in business for five years. She earns extra income from farming. Faulu Kenya has helped her learn how to save her money for future purposes. 

Mary desires to open a boutique. She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy clothes for inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 30 years old, married with two children. He is employed as a van driver, and also earns an income by selling second-hand shoes. He has been in business for four years, and is very hard-working. 

Faulu Kenya has enabled him to improve his lifestyle through their financial support. 

Benard hopes to buy a piece of land and open a wholesale shop selling shoes. He requests a loan of 32,298 KES to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 31 years old, a business woman who owns a shop. She has been in business for three years, and describes her business as facing much competition from other retail shops. But, she has managed to retain her business because of her good customer service.  

Faulu Kenya has helped her to learn how to save her money and manage her business well. 

She desires to expand her shop in the future. She requests a loan of 20,857 KES to buy maize flour, wheat flour, bread, sugar, rice, soaps and soda.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, bread, sugar, rice, soaps and soda for her shop.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 37 years old, married with a two-year-old child. He is so talented in hand crafts, and he uses those skills to make flower pots.  He has been in the business for 12 years.  He also does farming for more income generation.  

Gabriel is determined to grow his clientele in the future.  He requests a loan of 42,727 KES to buy clay and sand for making pots.

loans.use: To buy clay and sand for making pots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, gloves, chemicals, fertilizer,weed killer, etc. for her plantation (farm).

loans.name: Prudence 1 Group

texts.en:
Germaine, age 46, is divorced with five children between the ages 11 and 31. She has four children currently attending school. She is representing the Prudence 1 group. 

Germaine has a grocery shop, and has been operating it for 25 years! She has gained valuable experience, loyal customers, and a good reputation in her community throughout the years. 

Germaine will use the loan to buy rice, oil, peanuts, peanut butter, and beans to sell in her shop. Her business strategy is to offer friendly and helpful customer service. 

Germaine has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner; she has a good repayment record. 

She wants to have a cement depot in the future. She hopes her children will stay in school and get a good education.

loans.use: to pay for rice, oil, peanuts, peanut butter, and beans to resell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: JUAN JOSE ES UN JOVEN DE 21 AÑOS DE EDAD Y A SU TEMPRANA EDAD A TOMADO EL EJEMPLO DE SUS PADRES DE SER UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA,  RESPONSABLE Y HONRADA. ESTE ES SU SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITA Y HA SIDO PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS ACTUALMENTE ESTA POR GRADUARSE DE MECANICO AUTOMOTRIZ Y SU SUEÑO ES FORMAR SU PROPIO TALLER Y ASI PODER AYUDAR A OTRAS PERSONAS TAMBIEN. JUAN JOSE AGRADECE A FAPE LA AYUDA QUE LE HAN BRINDADO Y A LA VEZ SE COMPROMETE A SEGUIR SIENDO RESPONSABLE EN SU CREDITO. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA-VENTA DE CAFÉ EN PERGAMINO, COMPRA DE PLANTAS DE CAFÉ, ABONO QUIMICO Y ORGANICO.
texts.en: Juan José, 21, at his young age has followed his parents’ example of being a hardworking, responsible, honest person.  This is his second loan request and he’s been punctual with his payments.  He’s about to graduate as an auto mechanic and his dream is to open his own repair shop and be able to help others too.  Juan José is grateful to Fape for the support it’s given him and at the same time he commits to continue being responsible with his loan.  He requests the loan to buy and sell coffee in parchment; he will buy coffee plants, chemical fertilizer and organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and both organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Dúo Unidos Por Gracia Group

texts.es:
DUO UNIDOS POR GRACIA
Doña Emiliana es originaria de la aldea Xetzac, municipio de Tecpan,  tiene 45 años de edad tiene dos hijas y se dedica a la venta de refacciones y comida en la plaza municipal de tecpan.
Desde hace años ella empezó su negocio cuando  fallecio su esposo ya que quedo bajo su responsabilidad a sus dos hijas que necesitaban el cuidado de ella.
Ahora gracias al apoyo de sus hijas ella sigue vendiendo refacciones y comidas ya que es el único medio que tiene para salir adelante.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientelas para obtener mejores ganancias. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracio de comidas y refacciones.
texts.en:
“UNIDOS POR GRACIA” Duo

Emiliana is from the village of Xetzac, Tecpan Municipality.  She’s 45-years-old and has two daughters.  She works selling refreshments and food in the Tecpan municipal square.  She started her business years ago when her husband died and she became solely responsible for her two daughters who needed her care.  Now, thanks to her daughters’ support she continues selling refreshments and food since this is her only means of support.  She dreams with expanding the business more and offer a wider variety of products to her customers to earn higher profits.  She’s asking for this loan to buy merchandise to prepare food and refreshments.

loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Reyna Izabel

texts.es: REYNA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y DESDE HACE YA MAS DE TRES AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE JOYAS DE ORO Y A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS DE BELLEZA. Y ESTE ES SU SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A FAPE Y HA KIVA, A LA VEZ AGRADECE A LA FUNDACION LA AYUDA QUE LE HAN BRINDADO YA QUE ATRAVEZ DE LOS CREDITOS QUE LE HAN BRINDADO HA LOGRADO COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO Y ASI TENER UNA VARIEDAD PARA OFRECERLE A SUS CLIENTES. DOÑA REYNA TIENE UNA NIÑA DE CUATRO AÑOS Y ELLA QUIERE SEGUIR SUPERANDOSE PARA DARLE LO MEJOR A SU HIJA. REYNA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS JOYAS Y COSMETICOS Y ASI SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en: Reyna’s from San Martin Jilotepeque and for more than three years now has been selling gold jewelry and beauty cosmetics.  This is her second loan request to Fape and Kiva.  She thanks the Fundación for the help it’s provided by means of the loans that have made it possible for her to buy larger amounts of products to have a wider variety available for her customers.  Reyna has a four-year-old little girl and she wants to continue improving to give her daughter the best.  Reyna is requesting the loan to buy more jewelry and cosmetics to better stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Mercedes Habita en el  municipio de Ticuantepe, su esposo trabaja para una casa privada con esto le ayuda con los gatos del hogar, su  mayor sueño es mejorar de condiciones para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo, ella es comerciante desde hace 16 años, su casa de habitacion le sirve como tienda y muchas veces hace entrega a domicio los diferentes clientes, con este financiamiento que se le esta otorgando podra levantar su negocio ya que desea aprovechar esta temporada alta de venta y asi obtener mejores ingresos. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindando.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  Her husband works for a private home, which helps with the household expenses.  Her biggest dream is to improve their conditions to give her child a better future.  She has been a merchant for 16 years.  Her store is in her home and often she delivers to the homes of various customers.

With this loan she'll be able to boost her business because she wants to make the most of this high sales season to get better income.

She's grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva funds are giving her.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 34 years old and a single mother of two children. She earns a living by selling clothes and has been in business for six years. Faulu Kenya has helped her increase her profits and learn how to save her money.

She hopes to purchase a piece of land in the future and expand her business. She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melvina

texts.en:
Melvina, 22, stopped her education in the eleventh grade. She lives in Congo Town. Melvina is single and has a son who is 11 years old and in school. 

Melvina has been selling spray for men, spray for women, body wash, hand cream, face powder and lipsticks since 2008. She learned to sell from her mother. 

She is proud of her business because she makes a profit, and with the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child. She sells twelve hours a day and transports her goods by taxi. A challenge she faces is that she has fewer commodities. 

Melvina is requesting this loan to purchase more body spray, body cream, hand wash and face powder to increase her sales. Her plan is to further her education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, body cream, hand wash and face powder to increase her sales.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, 40, is a hardworking mother. She has been managing her business for the past five years. She lives in the Congo Town community with her husband and five children. Her children are between the ages of 8 and 20, and are currently in school. 

Fatu sells coal at retail in her community. She sells eleven hours a day. She loves to do this business because she makes a profit, and with the profit she pays the educational expenses of her children and buys more goods to improve the business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal to sell at retail. 

Fatu’s future plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal to sell at retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viand (tasty/choice dishes) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials needed in the making of hollow, concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 46 years old and married with two children. She is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. For the past five years, Emelda has been a farmer who primarily raises and sells corn to make a living. She earns 6,000 PHP each month from her business. Emelda joined GDMPC in 2010.

Emelda is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Dúo La Flor Que Ayer Plante Group

texts.es:
DUO LA FLOR QUE AYER PLANTE
EL DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR MARIA JOSEFA POSEE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO EN LA CUAL LLEVA YA MAS DE 10 AÑOS DE TRABAJAR EN ELLA. ESTA LUCHANDO POR SALIR ADELANTE Y DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS. TAMBIEN AGRADECE A FAPE LA AYUDA QUE LE HA BRINDADO. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCADERIA EN PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES Y ASI SUPERARSE Y ASI SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
The Flower that I Planted Yesterday Duo
Maria Josefa is a member of the Dúo group.  She owns a grocery store, where she has worked for more than 10 years. She is constantly struggling to get ahead in life and provide well for her children. Maria Josefa is also grateful to FAPE for the help that they have given her. She is applying for a loan to buy more stock for her grocery store, in order to improve her business and get on in life.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana de 25 años convive con el padre de sus 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Esta joven familia habita un hogar propio ubicado en un distrito de la selva central.
Diana es una joven madre muy responsable. Desde los 18 años ya trabajaba en distintas actividades ayudando a su madre en una panadería. Con mucho esfuerzo logró ahorrar y adquirir 3 motos, 2 mototaxis y una lineal, las que aún paga. 
“Mi pareja y yo trabajamos duro para pagar estas motos”, menciona. 
Su pareja se encarga de manejar una de ellas, haciendo el servicio de transporte local a los pasajeros de su ciudad, las otras dos movilidades, las alquila a terceras personas, ganando de 30 a 35 soles al día.
Diana se encarga de controlar sus vehículos, y de brindarles el mantenimiento adecuado. Cada 6 meses realiza el cambio de aceites y el diagnostico.
Tiene muchos planes en mente. Con los ahorros que obtenga piensa abrir nuevamente otro negocio de repostería, para eso continuará con su actividad con esmero.
Requiere de su ayuda para realizar el mantenimiento de una de sus motos. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP, agradece el apoyo brindado en éste tiempo. Da su palabra de ser puntual en los pagos. Pertenece al banco comunal “Luz y Verdad” y se siente contenta de tener socias responsables.
Destinará los 500 soles en el pago del mantenimiento de su moto lineal, para continuar alquilándola y obteniendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana, 25, lives with the father of her two children, ages 8 and 2.  This young family lives in their own home in the central jungle district.

Diana's a very responsible young mother.  From the age of 18 she already was working in various jobs helping her mother in a bakery.  With great effort she managed to save and acquire three motorcycles that she's still paying for, two motorcycle taxis and one linear motorcycle.  "My partner and I work hard to pay for these motorcycles," she says.

Her partner is responsible for driving one of them, giving local transportation service to passenger from his city.  She rents the other two vehicles to other people, earning from 30 to 35 soles [PEN] a day.

Diana's responsible for monitoring and maintaining the vehicles.  Every six months she changes the oil and does a diagnostic.  She has a lot of plans in mind.  With the savings she gets she plans to open another bakery business so she can continue with her business very carefully.

She needs help to do the maintenance on one of her motorcycles.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She'll use the 500 PEN to pay for the maintenance on her linear motorcycle, so she can continue renting it and getting income for her family.

She's grateful for the support this time and she gives her word that she'll make her payments punctually.  She belongs to Luz y Verdad Communal Bank and is happy about having responsible members.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her motorcycle

loans.name: Dúo Patzicia Group

texts.es: Dúo Patzicia. Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Wendy Maricela, de 24 años ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años, le da gracias a Dios por la oportunidad de haberle dado un negocio para poder salir adelante, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Patzicia.

Wendy Maricela is a member of this group.  She’s 24-years-old and has been working selling cosmetics for several years.  She thanks God for giving her the opportunity of having a business to get ahead with.  She’s requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Dúo Jordan Group

texts.es:
Duo jordan 
Jennifer es casada tiene 21 años de edad, ella inicio su negocio hace dos años cuando termino de estudiar por la dificultad que hay de encontrar un trabajo tomo la decisión de dedicarse a las ventas y con ayuda de sus padres invirtió en la venta de útiles escolares y ahora ella tiene una mini librería y miscelánea y esta muy feliz porque gracias a Dios le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio, ella esta solicitando el crédito ya que la época escolar se aproxima y quiere estar preparada para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de utiles escolares para la venta.
texts.en:
Jordan Duo

Jennifer, 21, is married.  She started her business two years ago when she finished with school.  Because of the difficulty there is in finding employment she decided to go into sales and with her parents’ help she invested in school supplies and now she has a mini-bookstore and variety store.  She’s very happy because thanks to God she’s going very well in her business.  She’s asking for this loan because the school term is approaching and she wants to be ready to meet customer needs.  She’s asking for the loan to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses and pants

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a married parent of 10 children. She works hard to support her family. Annaliza runs a fishing and fish-selling business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business through her past seven loans through NWTF.

Annaliza is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Abel

texts.fr: Abel est un homme âgé de 44 ans, fiancé et père de famille. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son acceuiel chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale,cartons de sucres) et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Abel is a 44 year old man, engaged and a father. He opened a food store in a neighborhood of the capital which he has been managing for 2 years already. His little shop functions thanks to his warm welcome, his experience in this domain and the clientèle which he gained with time. His clientèle is becoming large and he doesn't manage to satisfy it anymore because of his small capital which obliges him to buy retail. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his small business to diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar) and be able to increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profits in his business to cover the needs of his sector and the other part will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of absolutely essential products.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El joven Marlon quien creció sin una figura paterna solo con su mama hoy en día es un padre que vela por el desarrollo de su hijo de 3 años a quien desea verlo con una buena formación, por tal razón Marlon y su esposa trabajan arduamente todos los días en su pequeño negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares, en donde todos sus créditos los ha invertido para aumentar su inventario, en esta ocasión vio la necesidad de invertir en infraestructura, hacer su cuarto levantando la pared del porche de la casa, para eso necesita comprar cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y piedrines, esto lo hace con el objetivo de brindarle a su hijo mayor comodidad en un techo digno.
texts.en: Marlon grew up just with his mother, without a father figure; he’s a father himself now who watches over his three-year-old son’s development and who wants to see him develop well.  Because of this, Marlon and his wife work hard every day in their small business selling mobile phone accessories.  He has invested all his loans in inventory purchases but on this occasion he needs to invest in infrastructure to build a room and erect a porch at home.  To do so, he needs to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron and gravel.  He does all this aiming at providing his son with more comfort and a proper home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La joven Ana es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposo en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras. 
Ana tiene un  negocio que es la  pulpería. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  café, azúcar, pan, frijoles, pollo, carne, arroz, manteca, churros, agua, refrescos, galletas, leches, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Ana desea mejorar  un poco el estatus de vida de ella y de  su  familia. En unos años desea que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un mini súper, y  seguir  apoyando a su familia, ya que son de escasos recursos  económicos.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre   2012
texts.en:
Ana’s a responsible, hardworking, honest person living with her husband in a community in Choluteca in southern Honduras.  She has a grocery store.  She needs the loan to buy coffee, sugar, bread, beans, chicken, meat, rice, lard, packaged snacks, water, soft-drinks, cookies, milk, etc.  She hopes sales in the store will increase thanks to the loan by having more products on hand to offer her customers and meet their needs.  Ana wants to improve her and her family’s standard of living a bit.   She hopes her business will grow in a few years and become a mini-supermarket and to continue supporting her family because they are of scarce economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras - November, 2012.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lidia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña lidia tiene su negocio de venta de celulares y ropa, ella viaja  hasta al vecino país de panamá  para comprar sus mercaderías que oferta a sus clientes al crédito y al contado así ella va creciendo poco a poco  al lado de su esposo quien actualmente no trabaja porque sufrió un accidente y ella cubre con los gastos del hogar con el apoyo de sus nueve hijos de los cuales 8 son independientes y casados, quedando solamente 1 de 14 años a cargo de doña Lidia, ella aun con dificultades por lo de su esposo pero desea  ver bien bonita su casa por lo que este préstamo lo invertirá en hacer divisiones de cuarto y poner el cielo raso para vivir más cómoda con su familia para eso necesita comprar laminas de plisen, cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Lidia sells mobile phones and clothes.  She travels to the neighboring country of Panama to buy the merchandise she sells to her customers on credit and for cash.  This is how she’s gradually been growing alongside her husband who is currently not working because he was in an accident.  She covers all household expenses with help from her nine children eight of whom are married and independent; she only has a 14-year-old still in her care.  Even with the difficulty her husband’s situation represents, she still wants to have a nice house so she will use this loan to make some room divisions and install a ceiling to live with her family more comfortably.  To do so, she needs to buy drywall sheets, cement, sand, blocks, iron and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy building suppies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is aged forty-seven and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and three children who have all finished schooling. She has been in farming for over twenty years, producing beans, milk, eggs, peas and bananas which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats from which she will sell the products and boost her livelihood and be able to grow her business to double in the next five years.

High costs of feeds are her major challenge in farming.

Grace is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the quick loan processing.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Maxine

texts.en:
Maxine is 53 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maxine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Maxine has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Maxine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Aive

texts.en: Aive, 32, is married with one child. She lives in Capucao, Ozamis City. Aive owns and operates a plot of farmland, raising coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Aive has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Aive's plan is to save her returns to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines buying and selling vegetables. Conchita has been in this business for nine years now.

Conchita requested a 10000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables for resale. In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business together with her husband for 15 years. 
Ricarda is asking for a loan to buy to buy fertilizer and pesticides. 

With this, they will be able to improve and produce a good harvest. In the future, Ricarda dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Almaden

texts.en:
Almaden is a married woman with a five-year-old daughter. She has been engaged in sari-sari or variety store business for five years. She usually earns about 7000 PHP per month. Her husband is a welder. These are the sources of their income. 

Almaden is requesting a loan to buy additional stock of soft drinks, beverages, and pollard to catch the attention of customers nearby in her local community. Through this loan, she can earn more profit.

In the future, Almaden hopes to be successful in her business so that she can meet the needs of her family and provide for the education of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, hard liquor, and pollard

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 50-year-old widow with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elvira has a general store business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like sardines, egg, noodles, spices, etc..

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like sardines, egg, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 59 years old and married with 10 children.

Encarnacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Encarnacion has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Encarnacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 50 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She has a food production business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Emelda is requesting a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Dúo Venceremos Group

texts.es:
DUO VENCEREMOS
Doña Angelina es originaria de la Aldea Xetzac Municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 53 años de edad y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y crianza de animales.
Desde hace años doña Angelina esta comprando leche para elaborar quesos para venderlos en el mercado municipal de tecpan    y con los desperdicios ella cria animales para después venderlos.
Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y gracias al apoyo de el y de toda su familia  ella sigue trabajando.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leche para la elaboracion de quesos y compra de alimentos para animales.
texts.en:
DUO VENCEREMOS

Angelina is originally from the Xetzac part of Tecpan. She is 53 years old and has three minor children to care for.  She makes and sells cheeses and raises animals.

For the past 12 years she has been buying milk to make cheeses to sell in the Tecpan city market.  She uses the leftovers to feed her animals.  Her husband works as a farmer and thanks to his support and that of the rest of the family, she continues to work.  Her dream is to expand her business and income so that she can support her children’s education. She is asking for this loan to buy milk with which to make cheese and also buy some feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Marie  Joseph

texts.fr: Marie Joseph est une dame âgée de 39 ans,mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 21 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 03 ans environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en: Marie Joseph is a 39 year old woman, married and mother to 5 children whose ages range from 10 to 21 years old. Two of her children still go to school. As a business, she has owned a takeout business in a neighborhood of the town for about 3 years. She benefits from good experience in this domain, but her capital doesn't allow her to satisfy all her clientèle anymore and her clientèle is sometimes obliged to go to her competition. This is because of her small capital. With this loan she would like to increase her cases of drinks in order to satisfy the demands of her clientèle. This will equally increase her turnover as well as her profits and will also allow her to be in order in her business. The income generated will allow her to better meet her family's needs. Her ambitions for her business are to sell drinks wholesale.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks.

loans.name: Dúo Luchadoras De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCHADORAS DE SAN MATEO
Este dúo es conformado por doña María Magdalena ella tiene  35 años de edad, y tiene cuatro niños varones el mayor es de 14 y el más pequeño de un año, su negocio es una tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diario como azúcar, fideos, sopas, salchichas , aceites, crema, queso, y verduras;  situado en san mateo milpas altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para  comprar pollos de engorde y destazarlos, ya que sus clientes le piden pollo porque en su pueblo solo pueden bajar a el mercado de la antigua lunes jueves y sábados por lo lejos que está y ella menciona que la venta de pollo es de venderlo fresco por tal motivo solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
”Luchadoras de San Mateo” duo.

Mrs. María Magdalena is a member of this duo. She is thirty-five years old and has four sons; the eldest is fourteen and the youngest, one. She sells common supplies, such as sugar, noodles, soups, sausages, oil, cream, cheese and vegetables, in a place called San Mateo Milpas Altas.

She is requesting a loan to buy broilers and butcher them, since her customers order chicken from her knowing that the “Antigua” market is far from their town and they can only go on Mondays, Thursdays and Saturdays. She says that chicken must be sold fresh, and that is why she is requesting the loan.

loans.use: to buy broilers to butcher.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a 53-year-old farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. For more than 20 years, she has been farming together with her husband. 

Presentacion is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Victoria works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and she earns additional income from selling food. Victoria has sustained her business activities with her previous nine loans through NWTF.

Victoria is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 58 years old and married with nine children. She lives in Bacolod, Ozamiz City. Leonarda has been sewing for 20 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2007. 

Leonarda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through her cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, and other supplies. By having more necessary materials, Leonarda hopes to improve her output and increase her income. In the future, she is planning to expand her business or perhaps buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, and other supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a welding and vehicle repair shop in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from raising pigs and from a ready-to-wear clothing business. Gemma has sustained her business activities with her past three loans through NWTF.

Gemma is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her welding shop. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her welding and repair shop

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 45 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Filipina has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from meat vending and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dúo Flor Del Café Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DEL CAFÉ
Doña Simona es originaria del municipio de San Jose Poaquil, departamento de Chimaltenango, ella tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus dos hijos menores de edad,  se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de Poaquil, todos los días desde temprano salen a vender ya que es conocida por sus clientelas y el puesto que tiene en el mercado es visitado casi por toda la población ella cuentan con este negocio desde hace años y gracias a Dios cada año han crecido bastante y han podido satisfacer a las necesidades de la población.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue con su negocio ya que el apoya con las necesidades que tiene en su familia. 
El sueño de ella es ampliar y surtir mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras.
texts.en:
DUO FLOR DEL CAFÉ

Simona is from San Jose Poaquil, within the Chimaltenango department.  She has two minor children and sells vegetables in the Poaquil market.  Each day she goes out very early to make her sales, as she is well known by her customers.  Her market stall is visited be the entire population and she has had this business for years.  Thanks to God it has grown every year and she has been able to satisfy the population’s needs.

Thanks to her husband’s support, she is able to continue her business and provide support for the family’s needs.

Her dream is to expand and stock her business to obtain greater earnings and send her children to a better school.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable.  Vive en compañía de su conviviente Jhon, quien es conductor de vehículos pesados, tiene un hijo de 4 años, están instalados cómodamente en casa de su suegra. El negocio que tiene Rosa es la venta de comidas, como menús que lo realiza de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, además los domingos venden parrilladas de pollos, realizando este negocio desde hace 2 años contando con la ayuda de su suegra, iniciándose con un capital de un préstamo particular. Su actividad económica lo realiza en un mercado de la ciudad. Le gusta su negocio pues comenta le gusta cocinar aprendiendo de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Por el contrario no le gusta por el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio, por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar su techado donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice que desea estar cómoda con su banco comunal ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en el arreglo de su local para atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. También comprará víveres para a preparación de sus distintas comidas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 28, is a very hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being cheerful and kind.  She lives with Jhon who is a heavy vehicle driver.  She has a 4-year-old son.  They all live comfortably in her mother-in-law’s house.  

Rosa’s business is selling food like daily meals she sells from Monday through Friday; she tends to her customers kindly and she’s been well-received and demand is high.  On Sundays she sells grilled chicken.  She’s been in business two years and she gets help from her mother-in-law.  She started out with capital from a private loan.

She carries out her economic activity in one of the city’s markets.  She likes her business because she says she likes to cook and learned seasoning secrets from her mother and she also likes earning income to cover her costs and household expenses.  What she doesn’t like is the physical exhaustion because they have to rise very early in the morning to prepare for the day but this doesn’t discourage her and she continues with her business.  She wants to expand it and repair the roof so she can tend to customers more comfortably.

This will be her first MFP loan and she hopes for your collaboration so she can make her plans happen.  She also says that she’s comfortable in her communal bank because she considers all the members to be responsible people.  

She will use the requested 800 new soles to invest in her locale’s repair to more comfortably tend to customers and she will also buy ingredients to prepare her various dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and building supplies.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria, age 57, of Malaubang, Ozamis City in the Philippines, is married and has five children. To earn a living, Elueteria operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services. Elueteria has been in this service for 32 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from the business. In 2008, Elueteria joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Elueteria is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business, resulting from the loan, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 54 years old and married. Gilda is has four children, and two of them are in school.

Gilda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gilda has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and fertilizers for her business.

Gilda has been a member of NWTF for 10 years now, and has previously borrowed from NWTF 10 times to sustain her business.

In the future, Gilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 34 years old and married with two children.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Luciana has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Luciana aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bone cutter.

loans.name: Maudi

texts.es: Maudi, de 25 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora y empeñosa, así como alegre y amable, es conviviente con Marcos, quien es obrero. Vive en compañía de su pareja y su hija de 1 año de edad, instalados cómodamente en la casa de su mamá. La actividad que realiza Maudi es la venta de bebidas gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una congeladora que compró con sus ahorros, y la instaló en la casa de su mamá, desde donde atiende a sus clientes con bebidas heladas, desde hace 02 años que viene funcionando su negocio, paralelo a ésta actividad también se dedica a la venta de comida, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en la atención de los clientes que se apersonan a consumir sus bebidas gaseosas. Le agrada sus actividades ya que cuenta con un ingreso económico que le permitió salir de apuros ya tiene más gastos, ahora que tiene su hijo, tuvo la necesidad de invertir su capital para poder generar ingresos, viendo que es un negocio tranquilo en el cual su pareja la puede reemplazar cuando ella no se encuentra,  y viendo los resultados positivos que está obteniendo, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio. Además  incursionar en la venta de abarrotes abriendo una bodega en su casa. Por tanto solicita 1200 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de bebidas gaseosas  a precio por mayor en diferentes presentaciones y sabores, además de abarrote par la preparación de sus viandas.
texts.en:
Maudi, 25, is a hardworking, enterprising young woman in addition to being kind and cheerful.  She lives with Marcos who is a laborer.  She lives with him and her one-year-old daughter comfortably installed in her mother’s house.

Maudi’s activity is selling carbonated beverages and to do so she has a cooler she bought with her savings.  She installed it in her mother’s house and since then has been providing cold beverages for her customers.  She’s been in business two years.  Alongside this, she also works selling food.  Her spouse helps her tend to customers who come by to consume carbonated beverages.  

She likes her activities because she earns income that helps her get through economic tough spots with expenses she has.  Now that she has a child, she needs to invest her capital to generate income.  Since this is a fairly tranquil business that her spouse can take over when she’s away and seeing the good results it’s having, she plans to continue with it and also to start selling groceries in a home-based store.

Therefore, she’s asking for 1,200 new soles to buy carbonated soft-drinks at wholesale in various sizes and presentations and also to buy ingredients to prepare the meals.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of carbonated soft-drinks and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery, de 19 años de edad, es una Joven trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es soltera, vive junto a sus padres, a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Mery es la venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y conocidas muchas veces al contado y otras al crédito a 30 días, logrando buenos resultados y conociendo muchas personas, lleva en ese negocio cerca de 2 años realizándola ella sola. Paralelo  a ésta actividad también vende ropas para niños pero de manera ocasional por temporadas como fechas festivas, realizándola también sola, hace 1 años.
Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que puede manejar sus tiempos libres para dedicarlos a sus estudios. Además de los ingresos económicos  que le genera con los cuales puede apoyar a sus padres para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario comenta que le incomoda cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero eso no la desanima y tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con su negocio, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, además comenta sentirse  a gusto con banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y amables. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de niños de diversos modelos y marcas, pesando en esta campaña navideña ya cuenta con pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Mery, 19, is a hardworking, enterprising young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s single living with her parents who she loves very much; she lives comfortably in her parents’ house.  Mery’s activity is selling beauty products via catalogue among her friends, family members and acquaintances often for cash and sometimes on 30-day credit plans.  She’s had good results and has met many people.  She’s been in business nearly two years and works alone.  She also sells children’s clothes occasionally according to the season like during festive days; she also does this alone and has been doing it for a year.

What she likes about her business is that she can manage her free time and use it for her studies.  Also, she can use the income she earns to help her parents pay household expenses.  On the contrary though, she doesn’t much like it when her customers are late with their payments.  But this does not discourage her and she plans to continue working because she feels good and comfortable with her business because it gives her the independence she needs.

This will be MFP loan #2.  She’s grateful for the opportunity of having a line of credit to advance with her business and she also comments that she feels good in her communal bank because she considers the members to be kind and responsible.  

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy children’s clothes in assorted styles and brands thinking about the Christmas season since she already has pending orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es:
Narda, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, es divorciada, vive junto a su mamá y sus dos  menores hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante. Vive en la casa de madre.
El trabajo de Narda consiste en la venta de plátanos y bebidas, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en un local en el interior de la casa de mamá, el cual lo abrió ya hace  05  años  tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona, ésta  actividad lo realiza con la ayuda de su mamá y lo hacen con mucho entusiasmo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, es  rentable, y le gusta socializarse. Comenta que al iniciar su negocio tenía problemas económicos y no contaba con el capital necesario para apertura su negocio. Pero obtuvo un préstamo y esto le facilito comprar lo que necesitaba.  Ella sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto es muy concurrido teniendo todas las ganas de ampliar su negocio y en un futuro abrir un restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina. Con el préstamo que solicita, podrá comprar productos para ampliar su negocio, buscando comprar en mayor volumen para si tener menores precios y más acogida y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Narda, 49, is a cheerful, enterprising woman.  She’s divorced living with her mother and two minor children who are 16 and 13 years old who she strives for in order to get ahead.  She lives in her mother’s house.

Narda’s work consists in selling bananas and beverages.  She has a well-equipped space inside her mother’s house for this purpose she opened five years ago and she’s become well-known in the zone during this time.  She does this activity with her mother’s help and they do it very enthusiastically.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to earn income that gives her the peace of mind to be able to provide her children with the best.  It’s profitable and she likes to socialize.  She comments that at the beginning she had economic problems and did not have the capital needed to open her business.  But she got a loan and this facilitated her purchasing what she needed.  She continues striving thanks to her stand being very popular.  She very much wants to expand the business and in future open a restaurant because she likes to cook.

She will be able to use the loan to buy products to expand the business always looking for volume purchases to get better prices and be better-received and to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy bananas and carbonated soft-drinks.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Dos Group

texts.es:
DÚO BUENA VISTA DOS
El grupo está formado por las señora Marta Lucrecia quien vive en Aldea Buena Vista, San Pedro Sacatepéquez,  se dedica al bordado de blusas de tela a máquina y hace sus entregas en el mercado del pueblos. Ella tiene 4 hijos quienes están estudiando y vive con su esposo quien también es comerciante de playeras.  Ella nos cuenta que se aproximan las fiestas de navidad y ya tiene varios pedidos de blusas pero los hilos que utilizan no le son suficientes para sacar el pedido de sus clientes por ello necesita  capital para poder comprar  los hilos en cajas la cual le cuestan menos y necesita comprar varias cajas porque ella trabaja con varios colores. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
The "Dúo Buena Vista Dos" group was started by Señora Marta Lucrecia who lives in Aldea Buena Vista, San Pedro Sacatepéquez. She works sewing blouses on sewing machines and she sells them in the town market. She has 4 children who are studying and she lives with her husband who is also a shoe seller.

She says that Christmas parties are getting closer and she already has several orders for blouses but the material she has is not enough to make the orders for her clients. This is why she needs a loan to be able to buy material in bulk which will cost her less. She needs to buy several materials because she works with various colours. She is asking for this loan to buy the materials to make clothes.

loans.use: buy material for making clothes.

loans.name: Dúo Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es: Dúo Siempre adelante. este dúo esta integrado por la señora Yesica que tiene 21 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de sueteres desde hace varios años, esta muy contenta por hacer lo que a ella le gusta que es la confeccion, esta solicitando el credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de sueteres y luego venderlos, espera que por medio de ustedes otorgandole el prestamo ella pueda crecer un poco mas en su negocio.
texts.en: The "Always Ahead Duo" [Dúo Siempre Adelante] was formed by Yesica, who is 21 years old. She has made a living for a number of years making and selling sweaters. She is very happy with her work because she's doing what she likes, which is tailoring. Yesica is asking for this loan in order to buy raw materials to make sweaters and then sell them. She hopes that this loan will allow her to grow her business a little bit more.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make sweaters and then sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a good bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of jewellery and pearls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of smoked fish.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y luchadora, su conviviente la abandono hace 8 años, vive con su sus padres y su hijo de 10 años, por quien se esfuerza para salir adelante. Vive en la casa de sus padres. Ketty se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su bodega, la cual está instalada en un local en el interior de la casa propia de sus padres, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a todos atiende con amabilidad,  su bodega lleva ya 04  años de funcionamiento tiempo en cual a llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo en ocasiones de sus padres en sus ratos libres para la atención al público. Considera rentable su  trabajo porque se hizo muy conocida en la zona, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos a quienes les da una buena atención, ya que sabe que con sus compras le brindan un ingreso económico. Al  inició de su actividad no contaba con el capital de respaldo, por lo que decido hacer un préstamo a un entidad privada. El tener su negocio le da la tranquilidad de darles lo mejor a sus hijos, tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y surtir  su negocio con más productos. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 03 con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, está agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad y el apoyo que le brinda.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 nuevos  soles comprará productos de primera necesidad al por mayor a menor  costo para  surtir su bodega, ya que así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ketty is 32 years old. She is a cheerful woman with plenty of fighting spirit. Her partner left her 8 years ago, and now she lives with her parents and 10 year old son. He is her motivation to do everything she can to make progress in life. Kitty lives in her parent’s house, and she works selling groceries in her grocery store. She opened up her shop in premises that are part of her parent’s house. Her shop is very popular with the neighbours, and also with strangers who are just passing through the area. She serves everyone in the same friendly manner. The shop has been running for 4 years, now, and has become very well-known and popular. She can count on her parents to help out and serve customers sometimes, in their spare moments. Ketty considers that her business is profitable because she has become very well-known in the district. The majority of her customers are neighbours, and she serves them very well because she knows that it is their custom that provides her with her income. When she started out she could not count on support capital, and for this reason, she decided to take out a loan privately. Having the business gives her the peace of mind that she can provide well for her children.
